boardgame.name: Market Garden
boardgame.description:
Operation Market Garden was a military operation fought in the Netherlands from 17 to 25 September 1944. It was planned by Field Marshal Montgomery as combined land - airborne operation. The airborne operation was undertaken by the First Allied Airborne Army with the land operation by XXX Corps of the British Second Army.

The operation's objective was to create a 103 km long corridor into Germany with a bridgehead over the River Rhine, creating an Allied invasion route into northern Germany. This was to be achieved by seizing a series of nine bridges with airborne forces, with land forces swiftly following over the bridges. Despite this ambitious plans, operation turned out to be a fiasco.

Game covers the entire Market Garden operation. It comes with four scenarios, picturing the parts of the battle and the whole battle itself. It uses battalion scale.

"Market Garden" uses WB-95 system, with some modifications that were necessary due to a scale change.

boardgame.name: Tales of Aquatic Terror!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Terence and Judith hadn’t been away from shore longer than three days, but already the luxury cruise was alleviating their accumulated stresses. No working grind for a month, the kids safely ensconced in the best boarding school money could afford, and none of the neighbor’s irritatingly mundane tales of clogged garbage disposals and weeds in need of pulling. This was the life.

As the couple reclined on their deck chairs, the sun beating down on their toasting skin, Judith reached her right hand over to where she suspected Terence’s left should be. She wanted to give it a squeeze to say “Thank goodness we made this decision.” But instead of his hand, her fingers found something else to squeeze: slimy, long, and writhing.

Judith leapt from her lounger with a shriek, sunglasses falling from her face. The horrible sight that was her husband revealed himself before her! Something had replaced him, but not only him! Before her very eyes, the crew changed into cephalopods on legs!

Judith screamed for a long, long time, but nobody heard her cries, or those of the other passengers on the Swan. The liner drifted for another month before it was discovered, and by that time, not a living soul remained…

Tales of Aquatic Terror! is a book of playable stories for They Came from Beneath the Sea!, containing four adventures of varying length and complexity ready for play straight from the pages.

As with the stories in They Came from Beneath the Sea!, these tales of terror can be played in the mode of farce, horror, or anything in between. This book contains options for terror far at sea, frights at the beach, and deep conspiracies in 1950s American society, which isn’t as pure as it would have us believe. Each of these stories is fit to be played as one-shots or as parts of longer stories!

Tales of Aquatic Terror! includes:

A story of frightening disappearances in the coastal resort of Warm Rock, California! Only the protagonists can solve the mystery and stop people from vanishing.
A tale of horror at sea as a pleasure yacht finds itself caught between iguanoids, a U-Boat, and the US Navy, with the yacht’s passengers forced to take action to survive their vacation!
A mystery in Portland, Maine, where the Prefecture of the Pod engineer a conspiracy to take control of an important government official, and only the player characters can stop them!
A journey of aquatic menace as the passengers of the Rose Marie luxury cruise liner encounter a plethora of threats on what is supposed to be the transatlantic journey of a lifetime!
Playable characters provided throughout the book, immediately available to use or adapt for your stories.
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Koala and Wine
boardgame.description:
In Koala and Wine, each player starts with a secret selection of glass cards. They can see their glass cards at the beginning but then the cards will be face down.

The last players to own glass cards win the game.

During the game, players will try to steal each other glass cards but to succeed they will need to use their memory or luck as to succeed a thief they need to match the type of wine of the "wine thieves" card and the targeted glass.

Players can also use "action" koala cards that will help them during the game to reveal a glass for example or swap the position of glass cards on the table to confuse the others.

Finally, special cards will test the memory of the players and ask them to reveal a particular glass card, if they failed they will lose a glass card.

Koala and Wine is not a drinking game, it doesn't include or required alcohol.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Alien Archive 4
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

Aliens are everywhere in the universe of the Starfinder Roleplaying Game, their intent ranging from peaceful to pernicious. From robot dragons to crystal-infused humanoids and polyphonic gels to sun-skimming beetles, the creatures in this codex will challenge adventurers no matter what strange worlds they're exploring. What's more, player rules for a variety of species let players not just fight aliens but be them! Inside this book, you'll find the following:


Nearly 100 uncanny life-forms both classic and new, from the batlike grioth and horrifying brain collector to the vengeful endling and dreaded plasmalisk.
A dozen races with full player rules, letting you play everything from a fungus-uplifted animal to a humanoid made of magical coral.
New alien technology to help give your character an edge, including armor, weapons, magic items, and more.
New rules for grafting the strange physical traits of other species onto your own character, creating a staggering array of customization options!

boardgame.name: Starfinder Starship Combat Reference Cards
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Box

Put the rules of starship combat for the Starfinder Roleplaying Game at your fingertips! Whether you're a Game Master who needs a convenient reference for running starship encounters, a player who wants summaries of the crew actions your character can take, or a newcomer trying to learn the ins and outs of starship combat, this 110-card deck features concise guides to the essential concepts of starship combat from the Starfinder Core Rulebook, Starfinder Character Operations Manual, and Starfinder Starship Operations Manual on handy double-sided cards. Stop flipping back and forth through rulebooks—grab the cards you need and keep your starship combats running smoothly!

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive
boardgame.description:
There’s plenty of things to test a person’s mettle out in the harsh Western territories. There are cattle rustlers trying to steal your stock. There are bandits looking to rob the 10:13 to Yuma. There’s all manner of critters and a desert environment looking to deal you the death card. Now, the recently-dead have started rising from prairie graves to assault the living. This town is turning into cowpies.

Zombicide: Undead or Alive brings the Zombie-blasting action to an all-new era and location, bringing players to the middle of the mythical Old West. There’s new Survivor types like the Gunslinger, Brawler, Townsfolk, and Faithful, each with their own, unique rules. Then, of course, there’s plenty of Zombies to destroy. New game mechanics like Balconies and the Train will test players in new ways.

boardgame.name: Dish 'em Out
boardgame.description:
Rival diner owners are under pressure to cook breakfast for their customers as quickly as possible. As some foods take longer to cook, you will need to plan ahead so the entire order is ready to serve at the same time. Players receive points for each successfully completed order and lose points for wasted food and incomplete or incorrect orders. The player with the most points when the flow of customers runs out is the winner.

Setup
Each player chooses one diner board and places it in front of them.

Sort and place the food tiles and penalty tokens into each slot of the kitchen caddy.

Shuffle the customer order cards. Based on the amount of players, remove the number of cards needed and place the remaining cards back in the box (see chart at right).

The first person to shout out what they ate for breakfast will deal first. Give them the chef’s spoon and cards.

How to Play
This game is played in rounds. Each round consists of the following actions:
1. Dealer assigns customer order cards.
2. All players select food tiles.
3. All players cook food items.
4. All players serve their customers, if they are able.

After all four actions are completed, the chef’s spoon and the customer order deck are passed clockwise to the next player, and a new round begins.

1. Assigning Customers
The player with the chef’s spoon is the dealer for each round. The dealer draws customer order cards equal to the number of players. The dealer then assigns one customer order to each player, including themselves. You can keep a more difficult card with the higher risk and point value for yourself or assign it to an opponent in hopes of giving them more than they can handle. All players then place their customer order cards on an empty table space within the Orders section of their diner board. In later rounds, if all the table spaces on a player’s diner board are full, they must immediately serve one of their current customers, even if that order will be incomplete, before receiving a new customer order card for that round.

2. Selecting Food Tiles
Starting with the dealer, players take turns in clockwise order selecting food tiles from the kitchen caddy based on their orders and cooking times. Each player may take up to a total of seven food tiles, from up to three different food types. This is the maximum; you are not required to select more food tiles than you want or need. Take your selected food tiles, and place them in a stack on their corresponding spaces in the Prep column of your diner board.

3. Cooking Food
All players cook their food at the same time. When everyone is ready, the dealer for the round announces, “Cook time!” Now, starting with the top row and working your way down, move all food tiles on your diner boards one space to the right. Keep each round’s stack of tiles together as they move across the board. Some food types do not need to stop in each column. When a tile reaches a space with an arrow, slide it across the arrow until it reaches the column indicated. Once food items are in the Ready to Serve spaces, they can be used to serve any combination of orders (see Serving Customers section).Any unserved food in the final column of the Ready to Serve section will be moved into the Trash column during cook time.

4. Serving Customers
Players may serve their customers during actions 1 or 4 using any food tiles that are in the Ready to Serve area. When you are ready to serve a customer’s order, move the food tiles from your Ready to Serve area and place them on the corresponding spaces of the customer order card to check that you have the correct food items.

End of Game
Complete the round in which the last customer order cards have been assigned. Then the game enters the final phase. Still taking turns going clockwise, each player has the chance to select one last set of food tiles to place on their diner board. Cooking then occurs as normal. The final phase then continues with all players cooking their food and serving their remaining customer orders (repeating actions 3 and 4). The game ends once all customer order cards are removed and all food tiles have been served or moved into the Trash column.

Scoring
Players total the scores from their served customer order cards and subtract any penalty tokens received to determine their final scores. The player with the most points wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the fewest penalty tokens wins. If there is still a tie, the player with the five highest-point customer order cards wins.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Wicked & Wise
boardgame.description:
Dragons compete in a variety of ways, but one of their favorite ways to compete is by playing trick-taking games.

In Wicked & Wise, players are either the dragons who are playing a trick-taking game OR they're a mouse allied with a particular dragon to help manipulate the trick-taking game. Over the course of three rounds, each team of mouse and dragon fight over tricks, treasures, and coins to see which team ends up on top!

The game isn't all about winning tricks; it's about setting goals and utilizing magical treasures. If you can make enough of your goals or sabotage enough of the other team's goals, you'll have the most coins at the end of the game and be crowned king of the caves!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Asymbol
boardgame.description:
Shapes and lines are essential building blocks in our visual vocabulary. If you look, you will see rectangles, squares, cones, triangles, circles, straight lines and curved lines in everything around you. The ability to identify basic shapes and how they relate to each other is the foundation for understanding and solving more complex geometrical and patterning problems.

Asymbol provides you with 47 unique shapes to pick from as you assemble things, beings, places and events/activities to challenge others to guess your vision!

Object of the Game
Players take turns being an Asymbler (builder) by drawing a card, choosing one of the two subjects and using the various shaped pieces to create their subject. At the same time, the other players try to guess what is being created. The correct guesser and the Asymbler each earn a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Setup
Place all 47 Asymbol pieces in the middle of the play area.

Shuffle the card deck, and place it facedown next to the Asymbol pieces, creating a draw pile.

Give each player a pass token to be placed near them.

Hand the scorepad and pencil to a player to keep score for each round.

When starting the game, determine how many rounds to play before the game ends. A round ends when each player has had the chance to be the Asymbler.

The first player to name a shape starts as the first Asymbler.

Make sure the Asymbler can reach the pieces and has enough space in front of them to build.

How to Play
On your turn as the Asymbler, draw the top card from the deck, keeping it hidden from the other players, and choose one of its two subjects.

Pass Token
If both subjects are unfamiliar or too challenging, you may use your pass token to discard your current card and draw a new one from the draw pile. After using the token, return it to the box. Each player has only one opportunity to use their token as an Asymbler, so choose wisely.

Categories
When you are ready to start, announce the category of your chosen subject. Only share the category and not the subject you are going to create.

Assembling and Guessing
To create your subject, use any number of the Asymbol pieces from the play area. You can create with pieces lying flat or by building vertically. Moving the pieces is allowed to show motion and help portray your subject. You may not speak while you build, but making sound effects is allowed. You may use body language (nods and hand gestures) to indicate if a player’s guess is on the right track or not. Once you begin to assemble, all the other players can start guessing. They guess at the same time and can continue to make guesses until someone’s guess is correct. There is no time limit, but you may end your turn if you feel like no one can correctly guess the subject. Otherwise, the turn ends after a correct guess, and play continues clockwise.

Scoring
The first player to correctly guess the subject gets a point. If multiple players guess correctly at the same time, they all get a point. As Asymbler, you also receive a point for successfully creating a subject that another player could recognize. If there are no correct guesses and you choose to end your turn, then no one scores any points that turn. Return all the pieces you used to the play area, and place your card in the discard pile. Play continues clockwise with the next player becoming the Asymbler, drawing a new card, announcing a category and creating their subject with the pieces.

End of Game
After the agreed upon number of rounds has been completed, the player with the most points wins. In case of a tie, the players share the victory.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Adventurer
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

The Adventurer is a journal writing game for a single player. During the game you will be creating a world and filling it with it's own people, traditions and folklore by journaling your characters adventures in it. All you need to play is something to log your journey in and a standard deck of playing cards.

boardgame.name: ATS To the Volga I: Fight For The Tractor Works
boardgame.description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to the tractor works of Stalingrad with their first truly new map of this battleground in nearly 20 years. It's a big one, too, with nine 18½ x 12½ cardstock map panels on which to command your German or Soviet forces.
Contents:
9 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
10 new scenarios
2 countersheets providing German and Soviet infantry, weapons and armoured fighting vehicles
AFV Cards
Four-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product.

boardgame.name: ATS Leningrad I: Brandenburger Bridgehead
boardgame.description:
The time is summer, 1941. Operation Barbarossa is in full swing, and action on the northern front brings the German 6th Panzer Division on the scene in a headlong rush for Leningrad ... the prize of Armeegruppe Nord.

This is a monster game with a brand new map bisected by the Luga River. This is ATS' first significant treatment of early-war armour on the Eastern Front featuring Pz35 and Pz38 tanks duking it out with the likes of Soviet T-26, T-37 and BT-5 tanks, among many others

Contents:
12 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
8 new scenarios
6 countersheets providing German and Soviet infantry, weapons and early-war armoured fighting vehicles
AFV Cards
Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product.

boardgame.name: ATS Small Unit Actions I: The Capture of Balta
boardgame.description:
The Advanced Tobruk System takes you to the village of Balta, 120 miles northwest of Odessa not far from the border of Ukraine and Romania. It was there in 1941 that a joint assault on the village by German and Romanian units was interrupted by a pre-emptive Soviet attack, kicked off by a wave fighter-bombers and followed by stiff, combined-arms resistance from within the town itself. This module marks the debut of Romanian troops and equipment in the ATS milieu.

Contents:
12 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
11 new scenarios
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product, as well as Romanian personnel, Romanian Weapons/Vehicles and Soviet Early-war vehicles countersheets.

boardgame.name: ATS Operation Uranus: Stavka Bear Trap
boardgame.description:
As winter set in, the trap laid carefully by the crafty Russian Bear, vengeance to be exacted by his STAVKA Generals and those in the field ... snapped shut on hapless Axis Satellite soldiers from Romania along with Werhmacht soldiers from 4th Panzer Army and other formations. As the icy blasts swept across the Steppe, one of the greatest military calamities in history was unleashed upon the men of multiple nations. It was Operation URANUS.

This module provides comprehensive rules for waging winter war as well as some new winter-themed terrain features.

Contents:
6 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½", with new winter art
8 new scenarios
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with winter-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product AND Romanian personnel, Romanian Vehicles and early-war Soviet Vehicles.

boardgame.name: ATS LIttle Saturn: Hold At All Costs
boardgame.description:
Winter has arrived...in this Advanced Tobruk System module detailing the trials of Axis troops' struggles with not only their Soviet foe, but with the elements themselves. Set in late 1942 - early 1943 in the southwestern Soviet Union, German, Italian and Hungarian forces find themselves in a frozen hell, tasked with dislodging Soviet units on the west side of the Don River.
This module marks the debut of Hungarian men and equipment in the ATS canon.

Contents:
6 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
8 new scenarios
AFV Cards
Two-page special insert with winter-specific rules.

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product, as well as Hungarian personnel / vehicles and Italian east front personnel countersheets.

boardgame.name: ATS Freedom's Price: Poland 1
boardgame.description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Poland and the very beginning of Hitler's blitzkrieg. This module contains scenarios set in Sept. 1939 as brave Poles desperately attempt to stave off their relentless German attackers.

Contents:
4 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
8 new scenarios
2 half-countersheets providing Polish infantry, weapons and armoured fighting vehicles
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product, along with standard German personnel, weapons and AFV counters.

boardgame.description:
Go on a journey of discovery with the MONOPOLY Biel / Bienne

Biel / Bienne is the largest bilingual city in Switzerland and the second largest city in the canton of Bern.

Biel is the regional and economic center for both the Seeland and the Bernese Jura and parts of the canton of Solothurn.
It also has several universities of applied sciences.
Bienne is the most important center of the Swiss watch industry, ahead of Le Locle, Grenchen and La Chaux-de-Fonds.

All spaces are in French and German and the game is supplied with two packs of cards, one for each language.

On their turns, as an extra twist, players have to blindly pick a card from another player's hand and play that down as well.

boardgame.name: Heldenwerk-Archiv 4
Heldenwerk-Archiv IV
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Heldenwerk Archive IV contains seven short adventures that will keep your players busy all over the continent of Aventuria - because the work of a true hero is never done! For this anthology, all adventures have been supplemented with additional material and a foreword by the respective authors. This year's archive has a lot to offer especially to newcomers to the world of the Black Eye! Six of the seven adventures originate from the Heldenwerk series, the seventh was issued exclusively to events in 2020.

The Appleworm of Alriksfurt is a beginner's adventure set in the Middle Kingdom that can be played using only the DSA5 Fast Starter rules.

A Feast for the Eyes is about the business of beauty in the Aran capital of Zorgan - and the ugly machinations behind it.

If your heroes board a ship for passage through the Sea of Pearls and venture onto the Night Black Sea, they not only put themselves at the mercy of the sea god Efferd in this adventure ...

A visit to the Kosch seems less turbulent at first, but while tasting a keg of Angbar Bock, a danger soon emerges that threatens the livelihood of numerous brewers!

Heroes can embark on the Thorny Path, a pilgrimage from Punin to Neetha to face a series of trials involving aspects of the serene goddess Rahja.

The Girl and the Man-Eater is a Heldenwerk adventure designed specifically to complement the DSA5 Beginner's Box The Mystery of the Dragon Knight, and is playable with its simplified rules.

Ultimately, the Change in Chaos adventure illuminates the events in Khunchom set in motion by the death of Keïderan-Dajin, the Marascan Tetrarch of the East.

Seven TDE group adventures for 3-5 heroes.

Genre: adventure story
Requirements: depending on the adventure

Location: Almada, Angbar, Garetia, Khunchom, Lovely Field, Sea of Pearls, Willows, Zorgan

Time: depending on adventure, between 1038 and 1042 BF
Complexity (player/master): low to high / low to high
Experience of the heroes: average to masterly

Major Skills:
Social talents 3 of 4
Combat 3 of 4
Physical talents 2 of 4
Living history 2 of 4


Klappentext

Im Heldenwerk-Archiv IV sind sieben Kurzabenteuer enthalten, die deine Spieler überall auf dem Kontinent Aventurien in Atem halten werden – denn die Arbeit eines wahren Helden ist nie getan! Für diese Anthologie wurden alle Abenteuer um zusätzliches Material und ein Vorwort der jeweiligen Autorinnen und Autoren ergänzt. Dabei hat das diesjährige Archiv besonders Neulingen in der Welt des Schwarzen Auges einiges zu bieten! Sechs der sieben Abenteuer entstammen der Heldenwerk-Reihe, das siebte wurde exklusiv auf Veranstaltungen im Jahr 2020 ausgegeben.

Der Apfelwurm von Alriksfurt ist ein im Mittelreich angesiedeltes Abenteuer für Einsteiger, das sich allein mit den Regeln des DSA5-Schnellstarters spielen lässt.

In Ein Fest für die Augen geht es um das Geschäft mit der Schönheit in der aranischen Hauptstadt Zorgan – und die hässlichen Machenschaften dahinter.

Besteigen deine Helden ein Schiff zur Passage durch das Perlenmeer und wagen sie sich auf die Nachtschwarze See, so setzen sie sich in diesem Abenteuer nicht nur der Gnade des Meeresgottes Efferd aus …

Weniger turbulent erscheint zunächst ein Besuch im Kosch, doch bei der Verköstigung eines Fässchens Angbarer Bock zeichnet sich bald eine Gefahr ab, welche die Lebensgrundlage zahlreicher Brauer bedroht!

Auf den Dornenpfad können sich Helden begeben, die sich in Pilgerschaft von Punin nach Neetha einer Reihe von Prüfungen rund um die Aspekte der heiteren Göttin Rahja stellen wollen.

Das Mädchen und der Menschenfresser ist ein Heldenwerk-Abenteuer, das eigens zur Ergänzung der DSA5-Einsteigerbox Das Geheimnis des Drachenritters konzipiert wurde und mit ihren vereinfachten Regeln spielbar ist.

Das Abenteuer Wandel im Chaos letztlich beleuchtet die Ereignisse in Khunchom, die vom Tod Keïderan-Dajins, des maraskanischen Tetrarchen des Ostens, in Gang gesetzt wurden.

Sieben DSA-Gruppenabenteuer für 3-5 Helden

Genre: Abenteuergeschichte

Voraussetzungen: je nach Abenteuer

Ort: Almada, Angbar, Garetien, Khunchom, Liebliches Feld, Perlenmeer, Weiden, Zorgan
Zeit: je nach Abenteuer, zwischen 1038 und 1042 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): niedrig bis hoch / niedrig bis hoch
Erfahrung der Helden: durchschnittlich bis meisterlich

Wichtige Fertigkeiten:
Gesellschaftstalente 3 von 4
Kampf 3 von 4
Körpertalente 2 von 4
Lebendige Geschichte 2 von 4

boardgame.name: Der Biss der Spinne
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The landing of al'anfan forces on the northern coast of the Kemi jungle kingdom has succeeded. The force, led by the Black General Oderin du Metuant and the renegade Kemi Princess Rhônda IX Setepen, sets out to liberate the realm from the influence of its power-hungry Queen Ela XV and her Horasian allies. The army under the banner of the crowned raven has divided into three thrust wedges. The middle one of them, code-named Kaiman, marches under its general Marvana Zornbrecht supposedly unstoppable southwards towards the Spider Mountains. But no war consists only of the glory of the battlefield, of the victory of the righteous and the triumph over a vile enemy. Soon, even the specialists of the Ravenclaws are confronted with the horrors of war and the need to question their loyalties.

In the second adventure of the Raven War campaign, the spectre of war shows its true face as the heroes reconsider their position in the military hierarchy and decide with what feelings posterity will one day remember the Raven War.

However, The Bite of the Spider is also playable separately from the campaign background.


Klappentext

Die Landung der al’anfanischen Truppen an der Nordküste des Dschungelkönigreichs der Kemi ist geglückt. Die Streitmacht unter Führung des Schwarzen Generals Oderin du Metuant und der abtrünnigen Kemi-Prinzessin Rhônda IX. Setepen macht sich auf den Weg, um das Reich vom Einfluss seiner machthungrigen Königin Ela XV. und ihrer horasischen Verbündeten zu befreien. In drei Stoßkeile hat sich die Armee unter dem Banner des gekrönten Raben aufgeteilt. Der mittlere davon, mit Decknamen Kaiman, marschiert unter seiner Generalin Marvana Zornbrecht vermeintlich unaufhaltsam gen Süden in Richtung der Spinnenberge. Doch kein Krieg besteht nur aus dem Ruhm des Schlachtfelds, aus dem Sieg der Rechtschaffenen und dem Triumph über einen niederträchtigen Feind. Bald sehen sich auch die Spezialisten der Rabenkrallen mit den Gräueln des Krieges und der Notwendigkeit konfrontiert, ihre Loyalitäten zu hinterfragen.

Im zweiten Abenteuer der Rabenkrieg-Kampagne zeigt das Schreckgespenst des Krieges sein wahres Gesicht, während die Helden ihre Stellung in der militärischen Hierarchie überdenken und darüber entscheiden, mit welchen Gefühlen die Nachwelt sich dereinst an den Rabenkrieg zurückerinnern wird.

Der Biss der Spinne ist jedoch auch losgelöst aus dem Kampagnenhintergrund spielbar.

boardgame.name: Fée Toibelle
boardgame.description:
Four pretty fairies are invited to the grand ball of the castle. But before spinning in a carriage dancing under the stars, each must retrieve their crown, necklace, fan and handbag.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Commonality
boardgame.description:
Commonality is a family card game about collecting stuff you find in common. Find the commonality between things and collect sets of common images.

The compact, travel-friendly game comes with 150 cards showing a variety of images.

Setup:


Lay nine cards faceup in a 3x3 stockpile
Maintain a draw pile
Deal three secret cards to each player
Maintain a reserve area in front of each player.


Game Play:

On each player’s turn, a player can perform one of the following actions first:


Moves a card from the stockpile to their “reserve”
Discards a secret card and replaces it with a new card from the draw pile
Steals a visible card from an opponent’s reserve to their reserve


Finally, if possible …


Reveals and collects a set.


Once the draw pile has been depleted, shuffle the discard pile into a new draw pile.

Continue playing until no draw cards remain or are playable.
The winner has the most cards. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

Set Collection:

Players use one or more of their secret cards along with one or more reserve cards to make a set of at least three cards. Explain the connection between all these cards then flip upside down as a collection. Draw one or more new cards to maintain three secret cards.

We've suggested about 60 commonalities like:


round
scary
flat
mammal
wearable
on the farm
sports


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sleeping Gods: Kickstarter Edition
boardgame.description:
"Are the stars unfamiliar here?" she asked, and the sky grew suddenly dark, the star's patterns alien and exotic. "This is the Wandering Sea. The gods have brought you here, and you must wake them if you wish to return home."

In Sleeping Gods, you and up to 3 friends become Captain Sofi Odessa and her crew, lost in a strange world in 1929 on your steamship, the Manticore. You must work together to survive, exploring exotic islands, meeting new characters, and seeking out the totems of the gods so that you can return home.

Sleeping Gods is a campaign game. Each session can last as long as you want. When you are ready to take a break, you mark your progress on a journey log sheet, making it easy to return to the same place in the game the next time you play. You can play solo or with friends throughout your campaign. It's easy to swap players in and out at will. Your goal is to find at least fourteen totems hidden throughout the world. Like reading a book, you'll complete this journey one or two hours at a time, discovering new lands, stories, and challenges along the way.

Sleeping Gods is an atlas game. Each page of the atlas represents only a small portion of the world you can explore. When you reach the edge of a page and you want to continue in the same direction, you simply turn to a new page and sail onward.

Sleeping Gods is a storybook game. Each new location holds wild adventure, hidden treasures, and vivid characters. Your choices affect the characters and the plot of the game, and may help or hinder your chances of getting home!

Welcome to a vast world. Your journey starts now.

—description from the publisher

The Kickstarter edition came in a bigger and nicer box (featuring gold foil and embossing) than the retail edition, featured a painted ship miniature, and included the Sleeping Gods: Dungeons expansion and a set of metallic coins.

The RVM023 product code on the back of the box also indicates the Kickstarter edition.

boardgame.name: Time Void
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 characters of levels 9-11

A rebellious voidling in service to the void dragon Malinda set up the perfect ambush and devised a mechanism that transported the dragon into an extra-dimensional time-stasis chamber just before the killing blow was delivered. Once time was restored in the chamber, the dragon would be dead, and the voidling would be spared instant death when the dragon detonated.

The transport happened as planned, but somehow the dragon and chamber manifested on the Material Plane inside the temple cave complex of a sphinx. The sphinx sealed the chamber, refusing to open it until one of its three riddles was answered out loud; it refuses to accept answers telepathically.

The voidling needs help so it summoned the Void to these caves, knowing that the havoc caused would bring in the nearby villagers to investigate. They would be easy to dominate, and their deaths would be of little consequence.

It did not expect adventurers.

boardgame.name: Capture
boardgame.description:
Do you want to play with Vampirella?

Two to four players will travel around the board attempting to capture monsters (or wrest them away from their captors) until they have the entire slate of monsters on one side of the four sided board captured. Play as Adam, Conrad (aka Dr. Van Helsing), Pendragon or even Vampirella herself!

This is one of several somewhat tongue-in-cheek horror games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella among others) created by Bill DuBay and featuring campy 70's horror board game fun. The Capture game appeared in Vampirella Magazine #27 (inside the cover to cut out and play) as well as separately in a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order. The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

boardgame.name: Assassin War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger Room Encounters are combat simulations that combine realistic illusions, hard-light holograms, and matter re-materialization to simulate virtually any environment that offers benefits to both GMs and players. A session in Danger Room Encounters allows heroes to practice their skills and powers without worrying about property damage or bystanders. Heroes can try alternate uses of their powers and experiment with how far they can push those abilities. Danger Room Encounters serves as an excellent, easy way to introduce new players to the game by helping them learn the rules one step at a time.

This Danger Room takes place during a “Hero Day” parade. The parade follows a pre-planned Parade Route through an urban center and features a number of large parade balloons and floats, each depicting a cartoonish image of various superheroes. The guest of honor at the parade is visiting Senator Fredrick, who has been placed on a large float in the center of the parade. Unfortunately, two assassins have been hired to eliminate the senator – Sights and Stillwater. The pair are not a team, and in fact only the one that actually makes the kill gets paid. As such, the pair are competing against each other in this scenario.

boardgame.name: Port Royal: Big Box
Порт Роял: голяма кутия
Порт-Роял. Повне видання
boardgame.description:
Port Royal: Big Box contains the Port Royal, the first expansion Just One More Contract..., the second expansion The Adventure Begins..., the Gambler promo card, and the standalone game Port Royal: Unterwegs!.

This edition of the game features new graphics and art.

Title: Port Royal Big Box (NL) Publisher: 999 Games Language(s): Dutch
Title: Port Royal: Big Box Publisher: Pegasus Spiele Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Die Firmenfeier: Das letzte Fest des Oliver Borgmann
boardgame.description:
100 years of Edelberger chocolate. That is 100 years of customer loyalty, ambition and tradition.
The perfect occasion for a large company anniversary in a private company. And it would have been the best anniversary in the company's history had it not been for this insidious murder of the sales manager.
Who murdered Oliver Borgmann?
The killer was most likely among the guests. But which of them was cold-blooded enough to commit the deed while the colleagues in the next room celebrated happily?

Take a look behind the scenes of the chocolate factory and unravel a web of intrigue, blackmail, nepotism and excesses at Oliver Borgmann's last festival.

boardgame.name: Maustrap
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Maustrap is a pre-Mausritter campaign game mode. You and 2-5 friends will each take 4 common mice, who are in debt, on a grueling and grinding adventure; deep into the hearts of dungeons. Treasure hunting, seeking for the right amount of pips to set you free from your financial burden.

In this funnel you will test your characters to their limits and most likely, to their demise. If, and that is a huge if, your character mice survive, these lucky mouse adventurers will become the starting mice of your campaign.

So, tread lightly, heck, rather throw caution to the wind and go find some treasure and pay off your debt. The rules help keep the story you tell consistent, interesting and challenging.

boardgame.name: The Treacherous Tunnel of the Funnel Spider
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

In a broken down, col forgotten terra cotta culvert, a massive and wicked Australian Funnel-Web Spider has set up its creepy kingdom.

This Level 0 Funnel Dungeon assume GMs will use and be familiar with the Mausritter Core Rules.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 12 - Oct/Nov 2017)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
Issue #12
October / November 2017

Pandemic Legacy: Season Two

boardgame.name: Cavalier Vengeance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Joan of Arc and Diarmuid have returned, but with a vengeance! Can you help save the world against their fiery wrath, or will you falter against them and the other dark Legends that they've summoned to aid their war path?


Two New Legends: Dark Joan of Arc and Dark Diarmuid join the fray! These two feature all new abilities from their previous counterparts in the Core Rulebook.
New Game Mode - Gauntlet: Allows you to play a cooperative tabletop experience where you face off against rounds of bosses.
New Equipment: Ranging anywhere from the blazing firebrand to the haunting executioner's axe, this new equipment unlocks more possibilities!
Boons: Expand what's possible with "Boons," which grant your Legend new abilities! Can be used to make the cooperative experience easier or it can serve as a great story element for a standard game of Legendaria!

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 13 - Dec 2017)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
December 2017

Star Wars Legion

boardgame.name: Earth Rising: 20 Years to Transform Our World
boardgame.description:
A cooperative board game about saving the world!
Earth Rising isn’t about vanquishing evil or undoing some terrible plot… instead, up to six players must work together to bring the world into sustainable harmony.

Balancing the needs of people with the limits of our planets biosphere, it'll take strong co-operation and careful planning to reverse the damage done and transform our society into sustainability.

A co-operative game for families and friends, aged 10+. You have twenty years to transform the world, are you up to the task?

—description from the publisher

January 2018

Bogus board games - do you own a fake?

Fallout Wasteland Warfare - Nuclear PHWOAR!

boardgame.name: Dragon Dreams: White Wolf Allegiance Deck
boardgame.description:
Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

Includes:

1 Dragon God
1 Silva the Grey
1 Angel Card
1 Quest Land
2 Quest Creatures
5 Core Lands
10 Dream Lands
10 White Spells
8 White Artefacts
4 Wolf Captuveries
4 Dragon Constructs
4 Dragon Birds
4 Life Structures
4 Artefacts
4 Atalantian Towers
4 Captuveries

boardgame.name: Lorenzo il Magnifico: Top Shelf Gamer Deluxe Token Bundle
boardgame.description:
Replace the wood and stone tokens that come with the game with high-quality Stonemaier Games tokens set of realistic resource.

The wood tokens are made of a hefty resin and are hand painted. The stone tokens are made of a weighty metal.

boardgame.name: Jack in the Green
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Before, Jack would joyfully die at the hands of the mob, to release summer’s warmth.

Now the procession happens day after day, pulling some poor wretch from their rest, dressing them in the ragged, threadbare finery of Jack in the Green. Laughing and dancing, to the beat of a great drum, they march Jack slowly to the hilltop, and beg once more for the return of summer, for the return of the sun.

Based on the Jack in the Green festival found in the South East of England, Jack in the Green is a bleak scene-setting encounter that can be added into a Mörk Borg game.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 16 - Mar 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
March 2018

Rising Sun

boardgame.name: Death in Dinglebrook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you suffer from an arcane affliction? Are magical maladies making you morose? Then take a trip to delightful Dinglebrook! The legendary healing available at our state of the art Sanitarium is guaranteed to restore the body and raise the spirit!

Pocket Size Perils Issue#4 - Death in Dinglebrook is a, 5e compatible, mini adventure for 4th level. The double sided pdf's can be printed on US or international paper sizing and fold into a flippable zine complete with everything game masters need to deliver a session of 5th edition gaming. There's also a scrollable PDF for use on devices.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 17 - Apr 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
April 2018

The greatest designer of all time? How Wolfgang Kramer changed everything.
boardgame.rpg: My Little Pony: Tails of Equestria

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 18 - May 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
May 2018

A Song of Ice and Fire

boardgame.name: Amino: The Ant Game
boardgame.description:
Amino is an entertaining strategic tile based game for the whole family. Amino takes players on a journey into the microcosm of ants.

In Amino - The Ant Game you build a microcosm that every time looks different. In this microcosm you manage an ant colony, and to win you must be the first to collect the best resources. To do this, you lay out new paths and open up new resources and hill. With your opponent you fight for these resources and obstruct their pathways. With "Ant cards" you block paths, build bridges, lend wings to your ant, improve their fighting power or change the existing maze of paths.

The goal of the game is to quickly get the best resources for yourself. There are three different resources, which give you one to three points depending on their type. Now, some may be worth more or less to you than they are to your opponent. The first player to collect seven points wins.

boardgame.name: Escape The Box: Die vergessene Pyramide
boardgame.description:
Erlebt eine Schatzjagd im alten Ägypten und erforscht neun Räume, um dem großen Escape-Room-Spiel gemeinsam zu entkommen. Löst alle Rätsel und findet alle Glyphen, Schätze und Geheimnisse, um die Mission eurer Spielfiguren zu meistern. Mit bis zu 4 Spielern erforscht ihr die sagenumwobene Pyramide, gefüllt mit uralten Mysterien, tückischen Fallen und unbeschreiblichen Reichtümern. Aber nehmt euch vor den ägyptischen Göttern in Acht. Manche könnten euch zwar gewogen sein, andere aber auch euer Verderben bedeuten.

Discover a cooperative adventure in the world of mummies, burial chambers and sand, warm sand everywhere you look! Experience a treasure hunt in ancient Egypt and explore nine rooms in order to escape the great escape room game together. Solve all puzzles and find all glyphs, treasures and secrets to master the mission of your characters. With up to 4 players you explore the legendary pyramid, filled with ancient mysteries, treacherous traps and indescribable riches. But beware of the Egyptian gods. Some could be good for you, but others could also mean your ruin.

boardgame.name: Mémotager: Vegetable memory game
boardgame.description:
Setup:
Plant all the vegetables: carrots, turnips, radishes... Don't forget the rabbits!
Push the wooden vegetables into the felt, only the green stalk must still protrude.
Finally place the scarecrow in the center to hold everything.

Gameplay:
Mémotager offers two game modes:

a classic memory in which identical pairs have to be gathered
an advanced mode, in which a soup recipe has to be recomposed. The first player to collect the ingredients for their soup wins.

boardgame.name: Monster Match
boardgame.description:
In Uncle Creepy's Monster Match, you are attempting to amass an army of monsters by collecting two matching monsters from each of the four sides of the game board - the first player to do this wins! And everyone else presumably has a lot of hungry monsters to feed. Will they turn on their captors? You bet!

2 to 6 players spin a paper spinner to move about the board and may claim a monster if they land on it. If you land on an already claimed monster, you must battle the owner for control by betting one of your own monsters against theirs- the highest spin wins them both! As a side option, players may also offer to trade monsters to other players during their turn.

This one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie, Vampirella and others) was created by Bill DuBay and features their rad 70s artwork in classic "spin and move" gameplay.

Released in Creepy Magazine #56, Eerie Magazine #51, and the "Famous Monsters Game Book #1" magazine from 1982 (all from inside the magazine cover as "cut out and play editions") as well as available separately in a bundle as "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order. The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

boardgame.name: Mém'oeufs: Mémo sonore
boardgame.description:
Shake the eggs 2 by 2 to find the pairs.
An original sound memo with no shelf life!

Grab an egg, shake it and try to find the other egg which makes the same sound. A game of listening and awakening the senses with a box of 12 wooden eggs.

Winner is the player who can associate the most sounds.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 19 - Jun 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
June 2018

The greatest games of all time

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering - Homelands
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

By far the most prolific of the races, humans are present in varying numbers in every nation of the Homelands. They form the main populations of Aysen, An-Havva, and the villages in the Dark Barony, but can also be found in the mountains and floating isle.

boardgame.name: Psionics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The mind is the most powerful natural force in the world. Everything we have created to make our lives more comfortable and less stressful began as a thought; the same can be said of all the things we now fear. That cell phone in your pocket, that games console nestled under your TV, indeed the home you live in began as a thought; a vision inside the mind transferred to paper or computer and made reality through the labor of individuals who followed those plans. Without thought, without the human mind, it can be said that nothing would exist.

User summary:

The 55-page Psionics document is system agnostic; it is distributed with an 11-page (US Letter) supplementary document How to use Psionics with Savage Worlds.

boardgame.name: Le jeu de No
boardgame.description:
Le jeu de No ,
the game of No combines luck, strategy and knowledge about the Island of Noirmoutier through questions.

A family game that can be played with children, with questions designed for the younger ones.

Go on foot, by bike, by boat for a fun island tour!

Questions on expressions in patois, activities, the coast, fauna, flora ... not to mention the traffic rules on the road and by the sea.
1,200 questions on Noirmoutier island and on each card a photo of the island.

boardgame.name: The Farm Game
boardgame.description:
Take on the role of a farmer trying to build up your farm with pigs, cows, chickens, and sheep

Compete with your fellow players doing the same thing. Try to disrupt their farms while protecting your own.

Collect all three pairs of one kind of farm animal to win the game

Use other card types to buy, sell, trade, and support your farm - or to sabotage your neighbors

Make blind trades with your neighboring farmers to get what you need. Trades are limited only by your creativity

You can choose to be honest in your business dealings, but there is no guarantee other players will!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 20 - Jul 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
July 2018

Runequest - Revisited & Reviewed

boardgame.name: Big Trouble Adventure 05 - Bigger Trouble
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description:
The heroes have finally located the one person who can return them to their normal size and help them understand the motives of the nefarious Ostrumites. Though, getting to him is easier said than done. The heroes will have to make their way through a sprawling antique store filled traps and monsters. Even if they do find him, can he really return them to human size? Well lets just say things don't always go as planned. Big surprises and bigger dangers await, do the heroes have what it takes to face these challenges?

Bigger Trouble is a 6 encounter adventure that includes 4 new monsters, 6 new maps, and 1 new puzzle. Double-sized maps included for all encounters.

Also includes printer friendly version.

Requires: Big Trouble Settings Guide and Rules

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 21 - Aug 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
August 2018

Pathfinder 2nd Ed: the fantasy RPG prepares to enter a new era - but can it keep up with D&D?

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 22 - Sep 2018)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
September 2018

X-Wing 2.0

boardgame.name: From Out the Boundless Deep
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

From Out the Boundless Deep is a two-player game about a mech pilot and an engineer working on the starship the Boundless. The game follows the pilot’s dangerous missions off the ships, the engineer’s meaningful repairs onboard the ship, and the brief moments the two meet between missions.

This game requires a full tarot deck (printable cards are provided in the ruleset) and a six-sided die to play.

boardgame.name: This Hell of Mine
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

An adventure/dungeon for Mörk Borg.

A week has passed since the mine collapse. All efforts to move the giant boulders blocking the entrance have proven futile. Rescue volunteers have gone down the emergency tunnel - little more than a hole in the ground with a rope - yet none have returned. The proprietor of the mine, an influential and wealthy nobleman, is growing desperate - and it just so happens you are in his debt. Left with no other choice, you grasp the rope and descend into the mines...

boardgame.name: SCF: BUTTON MASHERS! – Pocket Edition
boardgame.description:
BUTTON MASHERS! is a fast-paced, pocket-sized card game for 2 players! Combo punches and kicks while trying to avoid your opponents attacks!

Great to take on the go or for a quick break between larger games, your luck and guessing skills will be put to the test! Guess correctly, and avoid damage. Guess wrong, and you'll take a foot to the face! Don't let your health reach zero!

Variable rules make it easy to adjust the game for all ages! Make it a simple guessing game, or change it up, and make it a game about reading your opponent's moves, or make up your own rules!

Players each have an identical deck of various punches and kicks. After deciding who goes first, the defending player guesses whether the next card to be revealed will be a high(↑), mid, or low(↓) attack. If they guess correctly, they take no damage and become the new attacker. However, if they guess wrong, they take the damage listed on the card and must guess again until they make a correct guess.

For more player control, have the attacking player select which card to put face down instead of just flipping the top card of the deck.

Players start with 25 life. First to reach 0 loses and gives their best cry of defeat!
Ready... FIGHT ON!!!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kleine Helden 2: Verstärkung! Lebenspunkte
boardgame.description:
Promo from 2020

Use this to track the life points of your hero with a glass piece or coin.

boardgame.name: Flockade
boardgame.description:
Flockade is a laid-back, party game with strategic elements about outwitting and outlasting your opposition.

Command an army of farm animals lead your flock to victory through attacking, defending, deception, and disruption, protecting your general at all costs to be the last flock standing. If your General goes down, you lose the game.

Each general offers its own powerful effect and playstyle to build your flock around. Build an army of basic recruits and powerful heroes to defend your General and attack enemy armies. Use orders to instantly take action or disrupt incoming actions and apply sanctions to other players for powerful shifts in the game if you catch them breaking a treaty!

To win, you'll have to manage your hand wisely and play your cards at the right times for the maximum effect. Shear your enemies with weapons, wolves, and wit to win and wool the world!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Wish you were here ...? Travel Edition
boardgame.description:
What's in the game?
Cards for sevenczones of the world. Each zone is a different colour and has cards for ten cities (numbered 1-10), plus a Travel Cuide card for the zone. There are two Travel Insurance cards, which are 'wild' and can be used on any zone when you don't have the required zone card to play. The rest are Golden Travel cards - you need these to win the game.

Quick Summary
The players travel in different zones. They are rewarded for successful trips and penalised for unsuccessful ones. Travelling a zone is done by placing down cards of the same zone (colour), beginning with a low number and ending with a high one (up to ten). Travel Guide and Travel Insurance cards can be used to gain extra points but they must be played at the beginning of a trip. Players can go on more than one trip.

The standard game is played by two people. There are extra rules for four players (two teams).

boardgame.name: Kawanakajima
boardgame.description:
KAWANAKAJIMA（川中島) is Japanese historical war game.

The Battle of Kawanakajima lasted from 1553 to 1564.

It is a War Game that reproduces a total of 5 battles in 5 game turns.

Players compete for victory based on the total number of area-dominated victory points that they check each turn.

This game is included in "WARGAME HANDBOOK 2019".

boardgame.name: Gremlins vs Automatons
boardgame.description:
What is Gremlins vs Automatons?
This is a standalone single-player version of Gremlins, Inc. which is playable offline, without any connection to any server whatsoever.


score: Why is this a standalone product


Because in order to make the game work offline, we had to re-write the whole logic of the game from scratch. So that right now, on the inside, it's a couple of very different products.


score: Will Gremlins vs Automatons be sold separately?


No. Gremlins vs Automatons will be released for FREE to every current and future owner of Gremlins, Inc. You will see it as a second product which will be added to your Steam library.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Althing
boardgame.description:
The Vikings's king is dying without leaving a successor.
Helped by a clan of Trolls, speed up the other players in this race for the throne.

At every step, strengthen your team by recruiting the right Vikings at the right time. Reach the Althing first to be crowned.
On your turn, complete the step, or recruit new Vikings to your assembly. Unless you want to trick your opponent or all at once.

Althing is an epic race with deckbuilding an rolling hand, for 2 or 3 players, with a great replayability. Althing can also be played in single player mode against a fictional player.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hentai Crush
boardgame.description:
As a single man who desperately wants to have a girlfriend, you have been introduced to a lot of girls via matchmaking service. Let's seduce them and advance your relationship...

Lots of animated CG of beatiful girls
Dating simulation elements combined with bubble shooter gameplay
Interesting dialogs
Lots of item to collect
Relaxing and romantic music
Cute and sexy native Japanese voice

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: How To Date A Magical Girl
boardgame.description:
Imagine if you had the opportunity to attend class at an elite academy for magical girls... Do you think you'd take the opportunity to make new friends? Learn magic? Or... Would you try to date a cute magical girl?

Although you show only a pathetic amount of magical talent, the academy has decided to let you in. You're not sure why, but this is probably a good opportunity to meet some girls! However, you only have one year to prove that you're suitable for the academy. You'll have to balance your studies and chasing girls in order to succeed!

Take time out of your busy schedule to go shopping, attend the debate club, work a part-time job or just relax and see the sights. The choice is yours!

As you get closer to winning the heart of your dream girl, you might find that not everything at the academy is what it seems.

An overwhelming sense of foreboding hangs above the academy like a dark cloud.

There's more to this place than the happy-go-lucky students are letting on...

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Trace: Thanatos in Nostalgia
boardgame.description:
It all began with a beautiful lullaby...

Forgotten Trace: Thanatos in Nostalgia is an enchanting all-ages dramatic mystery visual novel by developer Almaz.

"This is a love story adrift in time eternal, woven from the grief of a girl."

Nanami Kazuya finds himself in a place that he can't identify as either a dream or reality.

Under the northern stars, the young man who has lost everything when his dream crashed, is now all alone in a forest dark and snow-covered. Everything around him reflects the depths of his own mind, and the gloom of his daily life.

The only thing different is that the pain in his knee is somehow all gone...

Lured by an inexplicably beautiful lullaby, Kazuya walks through the maze-like forest, only to discover a captivating beauty singing by a lake, shining bright amidst the moonlight snow.

"I wanted to see you, Kazuya..."

She whispers and kisses him.

Right beside the couple blooms a single violet flower unaffected by the snow, as though watching them...

In Kazuya's town, there has lately been a string of mysterious suicides committed by people with various medical issues.

Someone with a leg problem jumped off the roof of a building; someone with a hand problem wrote a suicide note in their own hand before their death.

Kazuya recalls the snowy forest and how he didn't feel any pain in his knee there.

"Who was that beautiful woman? And what's the meaning of everything that happened there?"

There is one thing he does not yet know about himself: That he himself is one of the seven symbols that lurk in the back of his memories from the distant past.

And it all began with that beautiful lullaby...

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fired Up: The Agility Expansion
boardgame.description:
The expansion includes 2 more exciting Fighters that can completely change the game with their speed.

Add Keane the Hurricane and Yabai the Scarlet Fiend, each with a unique ability related to speed.

boardgame.name: Stap voor stap
boardgame.description:
In this game all players are working together in search for a solution to a social, health, animal or environmental problem.

One player (the know-all) is given a problem and can choose a fitting solution from 25 cards laid out on the table in a 5x5 grid. The other players (detectives) should find this one card from the possibilities by eliminating cards based on hints given by the know-all. Hints are given based on color, shape, size, whisper, depiction or drawing on the back of a detective.

If the detectives eliminate all but the solution card, they win the game. If the solution card is eliminated, they lose.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Catan: Summer Catan Hexes
boardgame.description:
Limited release - terrain hex set

These are just alternate art tiles.

boardgame.name: Guardians of the City II
boardgame.description:
An educational card game meant to teach players the value of community support in protecting their communities against threats.

Two players face off against each other, drawing and playing cards from their identical decks. Their goal is to resolve the crisis they are each facing, or to have deployed the most defense cards by the time both decks run out. The resolution of a crisis requires a certain combination of defense cards to be played.

Players can also play event cards to hinder their opponent's progress. Community support cards can be played to allow the play of other cards or boost their effectiveness; they also can protect against certain event cards.

Contents:-
2 identical sets of:

2 Rules cards
12 Event cards
4 Community Support cards
5 Digital Defence cards
5 Psychological Defence cards
5 Social Defence cards
5 Economic Defence cards
5 Civil Defence cards
5 Military Defence cards
6 Crisis cards

boardgame.name: Coalitions
boardgame.description:
Coalitions is based on the series of conflicts known as the Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars. Players, representing major European powers, compete against each other to shape the future of the Continent. The innovative and elegant game system allows a historical recreation of the conflicts, but better yet, can also create plausible alternative histories. The Alliances may take different forms, the campaigns may be fought along different lines of approach, but what the players witness is still a believable version of history.

Coalitions brings the whole continent of the Napoleonic Wars into a fast, playable system. Multiplayers—with NO downtime. Each turn, EVERY player is doing something… but doing something ‘different.’ This sets up an unexpected cycle like nothing you’ve ever played before. Cool wooden pieces, or a “Deluxe” version with some of the most beautiful miniatures you’ve ever seen. Kickstarter backers get exclusive sculpts, an extra player expansion, plus an extra game covering a slightly different period!

Throughout the period, Britain formed coalitions with almost any nation that would stand against France. Whenever a coalition was defeated, Britain sought to form a new one with states that would carry on the fight. Nations also had other motives to fight wars, often seeking to expand their own borders at the cost of their neighbors. Britain itself fought the French in Portugal and Spain and, with almost total control of the sea, sent military expeditions wherever there was a chance of harassing the French. Can the Emperor of Austria protect the German Reich and Northern Italy from the Revolutionary Armies? Will the Prussian King and Russian Tsarina join as allies or not? Will the Ottoman Empire be able to protect Egypt, the Balkans and Caucasus from the aggressive neighbors?

When you play Coalitions, you decide the destiny of Europe; your decisions will make history. Will you guide France to greatness? Will you galvanize and unite Europe to bring an end to the infant republic and restore the Ancien Régime? Or maybe there is a Metternich in you, able to deceive others and bluff your way to victory with a cunning smile?

Each player controls one of six asymmetric factions: France, England, Austria, Prussia, Russia or Turkey. They then try to form an alliance, insisting that it will be beneficial to all, although only one player can actually win. Throughout the game, players try to capture and consolidate key positions, which will earn victory points during the relevant phase.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Citytrip Junior
boardgame.description:
As a tour guide in Theme City you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting exciting attractions, wonderfull shops, wild animals, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Junior is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 15 starting points and 30 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends when the action stack is empty. The player with the highest rating wins Citytrip Junior.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Tales from the Oopsphere
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A single-page pocket sphere for Troika!

Explore the sphere that lies on the other side of the Oops Table with five locations and potential adventure seeds for when that double 6 is rolled ...

Created for the #troikaspherejam

boardgame.name: EXIT Challenge: Wettlauf gegen die Zeit
boardgame.description:
Alone or in a team with up to 6 players - age-appropriate puzzles have to be solved, strategic thinking and logical conclusions to be drawn. Put in the role of a special police unit, the motivated players set out in this Exit Challenge to catch the criminals who keep an entire city in suspense. The tricky puzzle fun takes between 45 and 90 minutes at the end of which many surprises await the other players. Thematically appropriate accessories, such as a code wheel or red filter, support you in completing the exciting tasks, and more than 70 puzzle, help and solution cards skilfully guide the player along the exciting narrative thread.

Alleine oder im Team mit bis zu 6 Mitspielern - es gilt altersgerechte Rätsel zu lösen, strategisch zu denken und logische Schlüsse zu ziehen. Versetzt in die Rolle einer Spezialeinheit der Polizei, machen sich die motivierten Spieler in dieser Exit Challenge auf, die Verbrecher zu fassen, die eine ganze Stadt in Atem halten. Zwischen 45 und 90 Minuten dauert der kniffelige Rätselspaß an dessen Ende so manche Überraschung auf die Mitspieler wartet. Thematisch passendes Zubehör, wie Coderad oder Rotfilter, unterstützen beim Bestehen der spannenden Aufgaben, mehr als 70 Rätsel-, Hilfe- und Lösungskarten führen die Spieler gekonnt entlang des aufregenden Erzählstrangs.

boardgame.name: EXIT Challenge: Notfall im Weltraum
boardgame.description:
Rätsel, Strategie und Logik erwarten die begeisterten Mitspieler – ob alleine oder im Team mit bis zu 6 Spielern. Als neue Besatzung der Raumstation ISS erleben die jungen Astronauten in dieser Exit Challenge den Nervenkitzel des Weltraums. Zwischen 45 und 90 Minuten dauert die Knobel-Unterhaltung bevor der Crew sprichwörtlich die Luft ausgeht. Passende Extras, wie Lochkarte oder Coderad, ergänzen die altersgerechten Rätsel thematisch passend, mehr als 65 Rätsel-, Hilfe- und Lösungskarten unterstützen beim schrittweisen Lösen der motivierenden Herausforderung.

Riddles, strategy and logic await the enthusiastic players - whether alone or in a team with up to 6 players. As the new crew of the ISS space station, the young astronauts experience the thrill of space in this Exit Challenge. The puzzle conversation lasts between 45 and 90 minutes before the crew literally runs out of air. Matching extras, such as punch cards or code wheels, complement the age-appropriate puzzles thematically, and more than 65 puzzle, help and solution cards support you in solving the motivating challenge step by step.

boardgame.name: Hivers IV (Traveller)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the final part of the Hivers series. This adventure leaves enough open to allow a GM to continue a Hivers based campaign but it also gives an opportunity to put an end to the Hiver threat.

This is an intense, combat-heavy final installment.

boardgame.name: The Book of Small Craft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is for the Second Edition of Traveller by Mongoose, though it should be compatible with any other edition

It contains descriptions, deck plans (with cluttered and non-cluttered versions), a couple of variants for some of the craft, Second Edition game specifications and some additional rules.

Full Roll D20 assets are included as a separate file, along with a handy smaller cut down version of the book, ideal for referee or player reference.

Although normally small craft are non-jump capable with have included a jump version of the shuttle (5 dtons bigger) and a bonus the 100 dton Scout/Courier.

Craft featured in this book are:

Shuttle
Assault Lander
Caravan Class Jump Shuttle
Modular Cutter
Pinnace
Slow Pinnace
Slow Boat
Hunting Launch
Type R Launch
Jolly Boat
Rampart Fighter
Runabout

boardgame.name: Ships of the Border Worlds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Leaf on the Wind

Travelling the stars requires a ship to take you there. When you travel beyond the edge of the Zhodani Consulate or the Third Imperium, you will need a ship designed for these pirate-ridden areas. Choose and launch your craft today!

This volume of Foreven Worlds details the Ships of the Border Worlds and includes:

Details on five new ships, ranging from the 100-ton Malforge Light Cargo Transport to the 700 Zhodani Frontier-Class Merchant Vessel
Beautiful top-down layouts for each deck of every ship
Descriptions of the ships and the worlds they come from
Plenty of ideas for you to incorporate these ships into your adventure

boardgame.name: Creatures of Distant Worlds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the Imperium, unknown creatures await unwitting explorers. Even in established civilizations, devious politicians and gangsters keep dangerous pets to show off their status. On frontier outposts, scarcely documented plants and animals attack any who threaten their habitats and food sources. With Foreven Worlds: Creatures of Distant Worlds, you’ll have a new monster to throw at your players no matter where they go.

This 29-page book features more than 60 new creature stat blocks. These include:

4 varieties of ants, from swarms of tiny creatures you can stomp with your boot to enormous specimens able to devour entire buildings
3 varieties of mutated canines called devil dogs, known for their mean disposition and terrible bite
Blob creatures that can cause significant damage even to ships, such as magmites and space oozes
Psionic plants and animals that coordinate their attacks and lure their prey to their doom
Expanded traits and numerous benchmark creatures which enable you to create your own native flora and fauna for your games.

boardgame.name: Reidian Flyer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Reidian Flyer-class Blockade Runner punches through enemy forces and orbital defenses with amazing speed. This starcraft outstrips missiles and quickly flies out of range of anything pursuing it. Now your Travellers can upgrade their game in the Original Traveller Universe beyond the Imperial borders. In the Foreven Worlds, danger lurks behind every asteroid—arm yourself well and live to make a cargo run another day!

boardgame.name: Infranqueable
Unsurmountable
boardgame.description:
You've climbed all of the mightiest mountains, yet there’s one towering titan that’s always eluded you: the mountain where anything can happen. In the whisper-thin air the paths twist and shift as you climb, stranding the unprepared and confounding the overconfident. Do you have what it takes to summit this perilous peak?

In Unsurmountable, players will be tackling the rocky slopes of an ever-changing mountain. As the game unfolds, they must place the next piece of the path carefully in order to complete a route to the top while simultaneously meeting any additional goals for the round. It may sound like a walk in the park, but this puzzle has plenty of pitfalls to keep players on their toes.

Unsurmountable is the next title in our Simply Solo line, following Food Chain Island and Ugly Gryphon Inn. These titles were designed by Scott Almes for single-player only, focusing on elegant rules that create complex situations. Like the previous two games, Unsurmountable delivers a fun puzzle that’s sure to hit the table again and again.
