boardgame.name: Fessor Cargo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fessor Cargo-class Multipurpose Ship can be altered with a moment’s notice to fit the mission. Whether you’re making a heavy short-ranged cargo run or a light multi-jump trip, providing medical assistance to remote locations, doing some asteroid mining to turn a profit, or taking on additional passengers, this ship can change its configuration every time it leaves the spaceport. If you never know what kind of day you are going to have, this is the ship you need. Now your Travellers can upgrade their game in the Original Traveller Universe beyond the Imperial borders. In the Foreven Worlds, no two days are ever the same—so grab a ship that is as adaptable as you are!

boardgame.name: Galleon Megatanker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Providing fuel to the most dangerous parts of space, the Galleon-class megatanker can bring fuel almost anywhere. This enormous 3,500-ton tanker can skim fuel off of gas giants and process it for use or sale. Whether performing regular fuel runs for in-system use or taking it to systems without their own source of fuel, this ship can handle the job. With room for passengers, this ship can take your Travellers where they need to go and help repel invaders. Now your Travellers can upgrade their game in the Original Traveller Universe beyond the Imperial borders. In the Foreven Worlds, everyone still needs fuel, and this ship can provide it, even in the space between systems!

boardgame.name: Corona del Rey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Corona del Rey-class cargo transport is a symbol of freedom and standing up to oppression. This class of starcraft is home to crews without a home now that the Zhodani have taken them over. Upgrade your game in the Original Traveller Universe beyond the Imperial borders with this new class of ship. In the Foreven Worlds, danger lurks behind every asteroid—arm yourself well and live to make a cargo run another day!

boardgame.name: Careers Beyond the Claw
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the Emperor of the Imperium has a Past.

Whether it’s someone who pushes the boundaries of known space or an average citizen waiting tables, every Traveller brings different experiences to their adventures. Now you can bring to life new and varied characters for your Traveller game with Foreven Worlds: Careers Beyond the Claw! This supplement adds five new careers perfect for your game, whether in the lawless region past the Imperial border or within its safer boundaries. Each new career features a D66 list of events, offering more replay value and new surprises.

This 30-page book for the Traveller Roleplaying Game features the following careers:

Athlete—a former sports professional who pushes their limits of physical endurance
Customer Service—a dedicated waitstaffer, someone who gets yelled at when the company makes a mistake, or a people pleaser who makes the customer happy no matter what
Frontierist—an explorer who goes beyond the edge of civilization to mine and forage, search for ancient ruins, or change a planet's environment to make it habitable
Medical Professional—a person who dedicates their life to performing delicate surgery, nursing the sick and wounded, providing long-term care, or providing physical therapy
System Guard—a member of the space military protecting a single solar system, whether they’re part of the line crew, inspectors’ department, or planetary patrol

boardgame.name: The Art of War: Card Game
boardgame.description:
The Art of War: Card Game is a fantasy tabletop card game in which the player will lead one of four factions and challenge up to three opponents for the title Ruler of Midlands. The game can also be played in military alliance mode, where two alliances of two factions are fighting each other.

The Art of War: Card Game is a great classic card game suitable for playing with friends and family. One of the distinguishing features of this game is support for simultaneous play for up to four players. Simple rules will allow you to quickly get used to the game and play it without any additional means to keep track of game states. And the non-collectible aspect of the game will allow you to start playing it immediately after purchase, without wasting time and money looking for rare and expensive cards.

boardgame.name: Solomani Worlds: Vehicles from the Rim
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vehicles From Earth and Beyond

Are you using the same vehicles when gaming near Terra as you do in the Spinward Marches? Move around on planets and their adjacent orbits in style with this new collection of vehicles! Each vehicle is designed with Imperial and Solomani systems in mind. Make the Solomani Rim feel distinct with all-new transports, racers, yachts, and much more!

Tell stories you never could before with Solomani Worlds: Vehicles from the Rim. Inside this 31 page book for the Traveller Roleplaying Game, you will find:

6 military vehicles, designed to take on threats big and small
5 transportation vehicles, ranging from family vehicles to jumbo g/jets
4 work vehicles, helping people to do their daily jobs.
4 pleasure craft, from hyper g/bikes and sports cars to luxury g/yachts
2 racing vehicles, ready for a day of entertainment or when the characters need to make a quick getaway
2 robotic vehicles, machines that require little human interaction
Descriptions of each vehicle, helping you incorporate them into your game

boardgame.name: There May Be Troubles Ahead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eight adventures for Referee and single player or very small groups.

A Troubled Memory allows a backwoods ‘barbarian’ from an unexplored world to encounter a wider civilization and much higher technology levels. This may provide answers to an unexplained part of his or her past life.

A Troubled Place gives a backwater noble a chance to make a difference for his downtrodden people.

A Troubled Library explores the fears of a librarian scholar regarding the safety of knowledge storage.

A Troubled Recovery concerns a belter who has been a victim of an accident and receives rather surprising visitors whilst in the Priory of Panunzio.

A Troubled Mind sees a parent’s concern for their child eventually involving the hunt for a secret, and illegal, psionic institute.

In A Troubled Treasure, deserters, Sword Worlders, archaeologists and others are interested in a valuable find in the desert with a PC or two caught up in the middle of finding it and fighting over it.

A Troubled Ship or The Frabjous Day, allows one, two or three novices to jump right into a Traveller experience and get a taste for what might lie ahead.

A Troubled Case juxtaposes city and desert as the PC or PCs discover all is not quite what it seems.

Includes a one page introduction to Traveller for beginners.

FULL DISCLOSURE: A Troubled Mind appeared in Freelance Traveller, no.58, October 2014 and some NPCs from A Troubled Case were published (with additional stats) in no.79, January/February 2017.

boardgame.name: Generation X
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feeling cooped up, locked down, shut in?

Experiencing limited horizons?

Seeing the same old faces?

Facing an uncertain future?

Generation X contains adventure set on and around a generation starship. The core adventure allows the Referee to either explore the departure of such a ship, events along the way or at the destination, and perhaps the standard trope of regression along the way. It can be used in conjunction with Supplement 12: Dynasty for those who wish to use those rules to link the generations together and develop factions – but this isn’t required.

In addition, the book includes Rendezvous with Karma by Stephen J. Ellis which can be used as a completely separate standalone adventure with characters from Charted Space finding and exploring a generation ship or which can be used in conjunction with Generation X to create a complex scenario of different groups of characters meeting each other.

There is also a look at every occurrence of generation ships in the entire corpus of Traveller over more than forty years, as well as notes on the role playing game Metamorphosis Alpha.

Finally, as a bonus work-in-progress there are three ‘further reading’ sections consisting of 40 additional pages of annotated bibliographies of non-fiction material on the subject of generation ships, fiction and audio-visual items such as films, graphic novels and music. This wealth of material can be used to inspire Traveller role playing or simply as an excursion into the genre with enough to keep those interested going for, well, perhaps an entire voyage!

boardgame.name: Three Blind Mice (MT2e)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

District 268 with its varied polities and existence in the shadow of the Imperium to trailing, and the Zhodani to Coreward is always a region where travelling can be, well, interesting. In the years prior to the Fifth Frontier War, these tensions can be exacerbated by any number of factions having their own agendas: political, personal, provocative. The Cold War between Trexalon and Collace doesn’t help matters. Close to the borders with the Trojan Reaches a desperate group of individuals is about to encounter a motley collection of merchants just trying to make their way.

Stowaways, agents, an orphan and the odd former slaver or two... it's all happening against a backdrop of disability in various forms and possibly even a wartime atrocity.

NOTE: First published by 13Mann, this Marc Miller/Mongoose Publishing authorized second edition updates all rules to Mongoose Traveller 2nd Edition, tweaks and clarifies the text, expands certain sections (in particular the finale), upgrades an NPC to a potential PC, adds Library Data and images, and includes Cepheus Engine conversions for all PCs, NPCs and tasks.

boardgame.name: Two Days on Carsten
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Where, did you say?”

Inevitably, in the vast expanse of Known Space with thousands upon thousands of worlds, Travellers will come across worlds of little interest. Often they will simply move on as soon as possible but for one reason or another they may have time to kill. Hours or even days can seem slow when there’s a desire to get out and about after being cooped up in Jumpspace for a week or more.

Two Days on Carsten offers the characters a chance see what sights there are on a backwater world. They can attend a dinner, visit a mine and encounter people and events that may become memorable or just another vague recollection of a brief stopover they once made.

boardgame.name: The Zhodani Candidate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spies and Agents in the Spinward Marches…

Some fourteen years after the end of the Fourth Frontier War the heir to the vital Duchy of Mora is poised to marry a heroic Marine returned from a long captivity with the Zhodani Consulate. Concerned that the Marine may have been brainwashed an Imperial security task force is gathered to vet the possible Zhodani Candidate. You will play the powerful and connected task force members in a game of intrigue, espionage, paranoia and betrayal.

Can you pierce the fog of lies and deception, protect your own interests and discover the Zhodani Candidate?

This adventure is designed as a player-led one shot scenario set in the Third Imperium for a Referee plus 4-5 players. This scenario is ideal for conventions or as a break from regular campaigns as it focuses on roleplaying, Player vs. Player (PvP) intrigue, social conflict and politics with a minimal amount of dice rolling or combat.

boardgame.name: Eve of Rebellion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imperial Intrigue!

Play Emperor Strephon, his heir and daughter Grand Princess Ciencia Iphigenia, decadent nephews Princes Lucan and Varian, or his advisors Duke Norris and Archduke, in this high(est) level adventure as intrigue and politics bring the Third Imperium to the edge of the Rebellion era.

But watch your backs! You’ll never quite be sure who’s about to make their move for power.

A rules-light, player-led one shot scenario set in the Third Imperium for a Referee plus 4-5 players. This scenario is ideal for conventions or as a break from regular campaigns as it focuses on roleplaying, Player vs. Player (PvP) intrigue, social conflict and politics with a minimal amount of dice rolling or combat.

boardgame.name: Truffle Shuffle
boardgame.description:
Who will be crowned the Ultimate Sweet Tooth in this fast-thinking, fast-moving chocolate challenge?

Roll all three dice and race to be the player to spot the sugary treat that matches the combination of colors, and then grab it first! There will only ever be one exact match, so you’ll have to be super speedy to snatch up that sweet and claim victory!

The first player to get seven truffles wins the game.

boardgame.name: Jolly Polly
boardgame.description: A banana tree is shaking from the weight of the fruits and the parrots want to feast on them! Easier said than done as the tree does not stay still. Every time a new parrot lands on the tree, it shakes and moves. The first player to place all their parrots on the tree wins!

boardgame.name: Cyberdoom Tower
Torre Ciberdiabólica
boardgame.description:
Year 2104, the machines dominate the planet Earth trying to wipe out the human race. You have been chosen to stop them.

Cyberdoom Tower is a solo and co-op futuristic dungeon delve experience where you try to collect the pass-codes to unlock the top floor of the Cyberdoom Tower and defeat the AI who controls the machines and save the world!
Explore the Cyberdoom Tower by moving your piece between the different floors of the tower. Fight the sentries guarding her by spending AP and rolling dice to determine your skills. Upgrade your gear deck to be ready for the final fight.
The more time you spend collecting access codes, the harder it becomes.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Demon Castle Mononoke
boardgame.description:
Demon Castle Mononoke is a cooperative bluffing game where players take the role of heroes defending a cursed castle from bizarre spirits of Japanese legend. As night approaches over the castle, only one hero at a time can take watch and see the spirit approach. Only they know the spirit's strength and whether it is friend or foe, and it's up to them to rally their allies... or lead them to their own destruction.

Using a unique blind bidding combat mechanic and partial information about your enemies, Demon Castle Mononoke is a parable about trust and teamwork. If the castle falls, no player can win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Bodybuilder Class Playbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I changed my name after my state change from a primarily biological being to a primarily mechanical one, but that doesn’t mean I’ve only been two people throughout my life, rather, I’ve been dozens. I’ve changed most of my components at least three times and before that I’d replaced all of the cells in my body an estimated four times. Every time I enter sleep mode, the personality that reboots is a slightly different one to that of the previous day. Continuity of consciousness, therefore, is an illusion. The key is that you never realize how much you’ve changed until a sufficiently traumatic experience forces you to confront it.”
-Theseus, Hivemind Cyborg.

The Bodybuilder is an advanced Class for the game of Monsterpunk. Bodybuilders have entirely mechanical bodies, which are easier to repair and do maintenance on at the cost of having less Orgone to draw from. As machines with souls they can do things like throw rocket punches or self-destruct their outer shells, which biological forms couldn't dream of.

Bodybuilders are dependant on having material resources to afford upgrades to their bodies. The Bodybuilder has a long list of selectable Tricks & Features that they can buy with Wealth, with the ability to install or switch around whichever they need as money allows. While other Classes must balance their Tricks & Features as they level, the Bodybuilder does not have this limitation and can fill themselves with whatever Tricks or Features from their list as long as they can afford them.

The Bodybuilder is recommended for Players that already have some experience with the Monsterpunk game system. In this file you'll find all the rules and lore to play as a Bodybuilder, example character concepts and a 1st Level build example with advice to play it.

boardgame.name: Urban Renewal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Head of the Adventurer's Guild in Cathoway has graced your presence and actually given your fledgling group a job! The city is undergoing several renovation projects and one troublesome property needs "adventurer" attention as it is believed to be magically trapped. Can you clear the building and build your reputation with one of the more powerful people in Cathoway?

The scenario was designed for a quartet of second level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Romandie
boardgame.description:
The Tour de Romandie is a Helvetian event with a mountainous route.

Switzerland offers an ideal course for the game with the Tour of Romandy.

boardgame.name: Guide to Faeries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of faerie is one of wonder, but beyond that thin veneer is another world ~ one of pain and suffering.

Fairy tales have been recited to amuse and frighten listeners with their wondrous words. Only a few know that those creatures they speak of are not creatures of the imagination, but exist in a world beyond our reality and comprehension.
Finally, the Leagues have produced a guide book to discuss the faeries, creatures that can be malevolent and benevolent in equal measure, and are truly creatures far beyond our understanding.

Contents include details of human interactions with the fey, the unearthly origins of the wee folk; the truth of the fabulous and frightening world of Faerie; a range of powers to help the Gamemaster create new faeries of their own; a large collection of both Seelie and Unseelie; and a number of greater fey with aspirations of their own.

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Hecata Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Pologne
boardgame.description:
The Tour of Poland is a very mountainous and very nervous event.

Because it is very mountainous, the Tour of Poland gives you the opportunity to explode the peloton.

boardgame.name: Tsukuyumi: Sunrise Kingdom
boardgame.description:
Time has passed and the Sun Goddess Amateraus, Tsukuyumi's sister, intervenes to save her creation. She opens the portals of ancient times and sends the Guardians to assist the living beings of the world. Sunrise Kingdom is set in the southern hemisphere where Australia once was. Here you are further away from the moon, but peace does not reign here either. Surviving factions fight for resources, habitat and against the Oni onslaught.
This is a 1000 copies limited edition standee version of the latest expansion for Tsukuyumi - Full Moon Down. This box contains 5 all-new factions: The First Guardians, Circle of the Sun, Sisters of Seven, Moon Circus and the Reef Collective.

Also included: a completely new game mode without a central moon: instead, you use portals to move across the map at lightning speed, while three powerful Guardians support you in your fight against the Oni. Each Guardian comes with a special supernatural power and changes the way they can be moved and used. This game mode can be played with all factions, including those from previous expansions and the base box.

The game comes with a new territory type: Amaterasu - territories that may not be conquered by Oni.

All factions come with cards for the 2-player mode, as well as the ever-popular faction events and their mascotts, and as always are fully compatible with all previous factions.

—description from the publisher

Zeit ist vergangen und die Sonnengöttin Amateraus, Tsukuyumis Schwester, greift ein, um ihre Schöpfung zu retten. Sie öffnet die Portale der alten Zeit und entsendet die Guardians, um den Lebewesen der Welt beizustehen. Sunrise Kingdom spielt auf der Südhalbkugel wo sich einst Australien befand. Hier ist man weiter vom Mond weg, aber Frieden herrscht auch hier nicht. Überlebende Fraktionen kämpfen auch hier um Ressourcen, Lebensraum und gegen den Ansturm der Oni.
1000 Stück limitierte Standee Version der neuesten Erweiterung für Tsukuyumi - Full Moon Down. In dieser Box befinden sich 5 gänzlich neue Fraktionen: The First Guardians, Circle of the Sun, Sisters of Seven, Moon Circus und das Korallen-Kollektiv.
Außerdem enthalten: ein komplett neuer Spielmodus ohne zentralen Mond: stattdessen könnt ihr euch mit Portalen blitzschnell über die Karte bewegen, während drei mächtige Guardians euch in eurem Kampf gegen die Oni unterstützen. Jeder Guardian kommt mit einer besonderen übernatürlichen Kraft und verändert die Art wie er bewegt und eingesetzt werden kann. Dieser Spielmodus kann mit allen Fraktionen, auch denen aus vorangegangenen Expansions und der Grundbox, gespielt werden.
Das Spiel kommt mit einem neuen Gebietstyp: Amaterasu - Gebiete die nicht von Oni erobert werden dürfen.

Alle Fraktionen kommen mit Karten für den 2-Spielermodus, sowie die allseits beliebten Fraktionsereignissen und ihren Maskottchen und sind wie immer voll kompatibel mit allen bisherigen Fraktionen.

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Tsukuyumi: Chronomaster Faction
boardgame.description:
The Chronomasters are 12 time-traveling apes who return from the future to save the Earth from disaster. This faction, similar to the Sentinels is a game changer faction that will definitely turn the usual game concepts upside down. Using time travel markers, they can protect their territories in a very special way and use their time paradox attack to teleport entire armies back to their home territory - as if they had never left. Be surprised how the Chronomasters bring exciting new ideas to the game, while adding and changing the game in the usual Tsukuyumi manner.

As always, this faction is compatible with all previously released expansions and also includes cards for 2-player mode, 5 faction event cards and the ever-popular mascot.

Two years before the Moonfall, a spaceship with an experimental propulsion system was tested. Just six years later, this ship returned to Earth, with highly evolved apes aboard - the great-grandchildren of the six apes who had been trained to test the drive.
Three generations later, the ship that created the black hole - the source of the drive - again traveled through space and time and returned to Earth. The ship was now populated by 40 apes who had converted the ship into a large space ark. They will come back to Earth to save it from what lurks in the future. There is only a small window of time for this, as there is already a wreck of their ark on Earth under tons of sand.

The Chronomasters are here to protect the Earth from the future, equipped with high technology and the knowledge of things to come.

—description from the publisher

Die Chronomaster sind 12 zeitreisende Affen, die aus der Zukunft zurückkehren, um die Erde vor der Katastrophe zu retten. Diese Fraktion, ist ähnlich den Sentinels, eine Game Changer Fraktion, die durchaus die gewohnten Spielkonzepte auf den Kopf stellen wird. Über Zeitreisemarker können sie ihre Gebiete ganz besonders schützen und mit ihrem Zeitparadox-Angriff ganze Armeen in ihr Heimatgebiet zurückteleportieren - als wären sie nie losgelaufen. Lasst euch überraschen, wie die Chronomaster spannende neue Ideen in das Spiel bringen und dabei in gewohnter Tsukuyumi-Manier das Spiel ergänzen und verändern.

Diese Fraktion ist wie immer mit allen bisher erschienen Expansions kombinierbar und enthält auch Karten für den 2-Spielermodus, 5 Fraktionsereigniskarten und das allseits beliebte Maskottchen.

Zwei Jahre vor dem Mondfall wurde ein Raumschiff mit einem experimentellen Antrieb getestet. Nur sechs Jahre später kehrte dieses Schiff zur Erde zurück, an Bord hochentwickelte Affen - die Urenkel der sechs Affen, welche darauf trainiert worden waren, den Antrieb zu testen.
Drei Generationen später reiste das Schiff, welches das Schwarze Loch - die Quelle des Antriebs - erschaffen hatte erneut durch Raum und Zeit und kehrte zur Erde zurück. Das Schiff wurde nun von 40 Affen bevölkert, welche das Schiff in eine große Raumarche umgebaut hatten. Sie werden zurück auf die Erde kommen, um sie vor dem zu retten, was in der Zukunft lauert. Hierfür gibt es nur ein kleines Zeitfenster, da es auf der Erde unter Tonnen von Sand bereits ein Wrack ihrer Arche gibt.

Die Chronomaster sind hier um die Erde vor der Zukunft zu schützen, ausgestattet mit Hochtechnologie und dem Wissen über die Dinge, welche noch kommen werden.

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Beyblade V-Force: Micro Tops Battling Game
boardgame.description:
Let It Rip!

Drop in your power cores and get ready to battle! Send your Micro Top spinning and knock the power cores into the goals. You get to keep all of your opponent's power cores that you capture in your goal. But your opponent can keep any of your that he/she has captured. Be the first one to collect ten of your opponent's power cores and you win!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: The Narrow Passage
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The Narrow Passage is a a short Trophy Dark Incursion where you take your loved one's body to the final, thin barrier between the afterlife and their world to beseech the guardians of the dead to let your dead loved one in.

Requires Trophy Dark to play.

A note: This Trophy incursion has no treasure. Dig deep on why the PCs are engaging in these funerals for their loved ones. What will they do to get them to the afterlife? At what cost? Make it personal. The afterlife here is literally a zero-sum competition.

Content warnings: Death, aging, maggots, funerals, possession

boardgame.name: Sea of Legends: Expansion
boardgame.description:
This expansion nearly doubles the base game content! Giving 4 new captains to play as. As well as 4 new factions to play against. All can be played and mixed with base game captains and factions.

CAPTAINS
Grimwald - Isn't letting a little curse get him down. This dead man doesn't have to worry about dying again.

Jack - Rules her ship with steel and spit. She's the type to stab first and ask questions later. Nobody is getting the jump on her!

Matchlock - Always brings his guns to a knife fight, or a sword fight, or any type of fight for that matter. And he's just itching for trouble. Or maybe that's fleas?

Liu - Has a short fuse and a real knack for blowing things up, especially her enemies. Turns out, cannonballs are a girl's best friend.

FACTIONS
Ordo of Nocturnus - sends their initiates to infiltrate the ports, establishing secret cults. Once they have five in place, they summon their demon-prince, Nocturne.

Aztec Reawakening - players will receive a cursed Aztec coin whenever they’d gain 5 or more gold at one time. These coins have negative effects similar to Nemesis abilities.

Sea’s Fury - the coven of sea witches believes all pirates are guilty of stealing their relics. The Spirit of Vengeance summons Sea Elementals that will try to sneak aboard your ship and take relics back.

Harpy’s Descent - the player with the most Notoriety will get a Hunted token, the Harpy chases down that player.

boardgame.name: CastleStorm II
boardgame.description: Aim your catapults! Command your troops! Bloody the battlefield! Gaming’s most charming genre mashup returns, leveling up everything you loved in the original with Unreal Engine 4-powered ruthless destruction. A whole new metagame of strategic conquest adds turn-based tactical intrigue to mix. Dominate six distinct story-driven campaigns – even PvP and co-op multiplayer modes – as you plot your path to triumph. That is, if you can earn it through chaotic carnage and delightful devastation.

boardgame.name: Micro Mariners
boardgame.description:
Welcome, researchers!
An unusually high amount of rare marine life has been spotted in a nearby cove. Whether you are an amateur or an expert diver, you cannot pass up the chance to research these amazing creatures. Make new discoveries to gain points, but don’t be naive, many of these creatures still pose a threat to those who wander too carelessly into their home!


Contents

8 Amateur Diver Tokens
8 Expert Tokens
2 Dice
16 Creature Cards
1 Rules Card
1 Research Vessel / Reference Card



How to Play

SETUP - Place the Research Vessel (RV) card to the side of the playing area. Spread the remaining cards face-down. Each player receives either the Red & Gold, or Blue & Silver set of diver tokens. Gold & Silver are experts, and let you adjust your dice roll by +/-1 on the turn they are added to a card.

ON YOUR TURN - The lowest dice roll goes first. Place 2 amateurs or 1 expert token on any face-down card (or face-up card that you control) per turn. Roll both dice. If either dice matches the back of the card, flip it and place your token on a free square. If the roll total matches any face-up cards with your diver on them, take the action shown and end your turn.

DISCOVERIES - Each player may have a diver on a card back, however only the player who discovers it may add their tokens once the card flips. The losing player’s token is returned to them. If you place divers on all available spaces on a card, on your next turn you may take the card as a Discovery Point, and retrieve your divers.

INJURIES & ACCIDENTS - Dangerous creatures can injure your divers and send them to the RV. Once ‘healed’ after 3 turns for injuries, or 1 for accidents, they can be placed again.

HOW TO WIN - Collect 8 Discovery Points to win. Deduct 1 point for each diver still in recovery at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: AD&D Character Sheets (Planar Games)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Planar Games (the publisher of early issues of Australian Realms) offered packs of 50 AD&D Character Sheets.

These sheets were labeled and intended for use with Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition), though they were advertised as "not approved by TSR".

boardgame.name: Monster's Castle
boardgame.description:
You can run from hideous horrors in the MONSTER'S CASTLE - but can you avoid the traps, the double traps, and ghoulish monsters to reach the exit?

A colorful but thin spin and move game, one of five similar titles published by Warren publications (best known for publishing Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella magazines in the mid 70's).

This game appeared in "Famous Monsters" issue #106 as well as part of the 5 game bundle offered in Warren magazines circa 1974, and was printed (as the others) on thin magazine cover stock glossy paper.

boardgame.name: Wanderhome
boardgame.description:
Wanderhome is a pastoral fantasy Role-Playing Game about traveling animal-folk, the world they inhabit, and the way the seasons change. It is a game filled with grassy fields, mossy shrines, herds of chubby bumblebees, opossums in sundresses, salamanders with suspenders, starry night skies, and the most beautiful sunsets you can imagine. You might be a tamarin who dances with small and forgotten gods, a leporine mail carrier who relies on moths to get packages where they belong, a little lizard with a big heart and a mysterious past, or a near-endless number of other thrilling possibilities. No matter what, we’re always travelers—animal-folk who go from village to village and get to see the length and breadth of all the world of Hæth. The seasons will change as we play, and we will change with them. But I can’t tell you all that will happen on our journey together, along the winding dirt road and amid the grassy fields. We’re just going to have to find that out together.

~ from the Kickstarter page

listing.notes: Wanderhome (Hardcover) + printed sheets forms (everything unopened) Long time delayed Kickstarter delivery, meantime I requested another copy which arrived in time. All money will go to Ukraine. Shipping included.

boardgame.name: Captain's Log
boardgame.description:
What is Captain’s Log the board game?

It is a 1-4 players sandbox board game with an estimated playing time of 1-4 hours and recommended for people aged 14+ where you will be in charge of a ship from the colonial period and you will compete against other players to become the most famous captain of all.

The game starts with the election of our ship. You will have a choice between a swift and agile but fragile ship; a well-balanced ship, if you want to play it safe; and a heavy and slow but strong ship.

With our ship, we will try to become the most famous and well-known captain of all seven seas and get a place in history. How? We can transform our ship into a frightening man-o-war and loot boarded ships or into the fastest sailboat ever imagined. We will be able to trade in the market to get doubloons, grow our crew, improve our weapons and load capacity, enrol on a mission and get a reward, explore the ocean to search for treasures, fight against or with others, and above all acquire wealth.
At the end of the day, it’s a sandbox board game, so you set the limits or the board does.

Throughout the game, we will make contact with other ships commanded by our friends (although we know in a board game is better not to rely on friendships). While exploring the map, we will start catching sight of other ships belonging to the different nations in the game. These are Spain, Holland, France, England, and pirates and corsairs. During the game, you will be able to decide if you want to side with any of these nations which will give you a variety of perks. However, nothing in this life comes for free and your acts might take you to make enemies of some other nations which will make their ships come after yours and try to sink you into the ocean.

Can you be a pirate and become another nation’s ally? Of course! You will sign a letter of marque with that nation and you will become a corsair/pirate. This way you will be able to get up to mischief but you will be loyal to the other nation and leave their ships alone.

As the game moves forward, the sea and wind might not always be in your favour, a storm might surprise us. What if the wind stops all of the sudden or there is low tide? We will have to be ready to deal with our enemies as well as the ever-changing weather.
This is just an overview of the game but, fear not! Once you purchase it, you will get an in-depth instruction manual.
After finishing this “captain’s log” and if you reach the required fame before the rest of the players, you will be crowned the most famous captain in the history of the Caribbean!

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Le grand Tour du Monde
boardgame.description:
With Le grand Tour du Monde Discover 232 destinations around the world, their must-see sites, the best season to go there, anecdotes ...

Using the dice, go around the world answering as many questions as possible.
Be careful, a trip always holds surprises!

The cards are illustrated with photos, 1000 questions divided by continent, various themes (culture and heritage, nature and landscapes, world cuisine, sports and adventures, practical advice)

boardgame.name: Jenga: Book Lovers Edition
boardgame.description: From the instructions in the box: The object is to remove one block at a time from the tower. Read and answer the question aloud that appears on the block and then stack it on top. The last player to stack a block without making the tower fall wins the game. The most avid reader assembles the tower and then goes first. Play passes to the left. On your turn, carefully remove one block from anywhere below the highest completed story of the tower. Use only one hand. Then stack the block on top of the tower at right angles to the blocks just below it. As the block is removed, read the question on it out loud. Answer the question and let the conversation flow as you stack the block on top of the tower. You can touch blocks to find a loose one, but if you move a block out of place, you must put it back in place using one hand only before touching another block. While stacking, always complete a 3-block story before starting a higher one. Your turn ends 10 seconds after you stack your block or as soon as the next player touches one.

boardgame.name: Jenga: The Walking Dead Edition
boardgame.description:
This is The Walking Dead edition of the Jenga classic block stacking game.

Players remove and stack custom blocks, with game-changing actions.

(Back of the box)

boardgame.name: Alien Frenzy
boardgame.description:
At just 103,027,000,000,000kms from Earth and orbiting a tiny little star in the constellation Virgo is a planet we call Ross 128b. The rest of the galaxy however know it as Sorr, named after the Sorras who today became the first Alien civilisation to make direct contact with Earth. A rough translation of their message: "Leaving now, be there soon!"

Alien Frenzy is a card game set during the prelude to and then following an Alien Invasion. Each player is in charge of recruiting a team of characters to help them fend off various aliens as they wander the Earth creating havoc. Manage your hand wisely as once you no longer have any character cards in your hand you are eliminated from the game. Last player standing wins.

To start the game players are dealt 7 cards from the Main deck and they then take turns playing and drawing cards until someone draws the Invasion card. This represents the moment the Alien Invasion occurs and triggers the Invasion phase of the game. Players then move to drawing cards from the Alien deck in the hope that they can defend against any Alien attacks they come across. One by one players are eliminated and lose the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dom Rusalok
boardgame.description:
A point-and-click horror-adventure game about childhood of post-soviet kids in 1990's Russia — a space where no one can hear your scream.

Russia in the '90s. A provincial town on the outskirts of the crumbling Soviet Empire. A big yard where many kids hang out. They make friends, fight and reconcile, love and hate, but mostly just play. Life goes on as usual until one kid mysteriously goes missing, and the rest of the group has to face the horror they are unable to comprehend – the DØM RUSALOK. This is a place where the worst nightmares come true.

DØM RUSALOK – is a story that follows the traditions of great works by Stephen King and Robert Stine. It is a story about children who have to face a disturbing horror. Only this time action does not take place in cozy suburban America but at cellars, basements and yards of provincial 90's Russia. The post-soviet russian setting gives the game a unique atmosphere like no other. It creates a space where no one can hear your scream.

A number of challenges awaits the children who are about to discover the deepest darkest secrets hidden away in a human soul. A homicidal maniac is on the loose, while the street gangs thrive under the police protection. A cult with a TV psychic medium leader grows in popularity among the people. However, most importantly, at the heart of an abandoned research institute, which the town was originally built around, a somewhat chthonic power is about to awaken.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Broken Compass - Adventure Journal
boardgame.description:
Publusher blurb:
In Broken Compass, Players are Adventurers looking for a Treasure!
The characters of Broken Compass are men and women of action who travel the world facing the dangers of big cities and the wildest and most inhospitable areas. Adventurers risk their lives every day, driven by the desire to find, obtain or discover something that is priceless to them.

boardgame.name: Broken Compass - Season 1 Golden Age
boardgame.description:
Publusher blurb:
The Golden Age Expansion Manual contains a new setting between the 1920s and 1930s, an entire Season (Game Campaign) ready to play and to customize, new options for Adventurers and all the rules for managing Supernatural elements!

boardgame.name: Endless Voyage
boardgame.description:
“Endless Voyage” is a Roguelike strategy card game. Follow captain Qin, who leads her sailors into a labyrinth of boulders. combine your deck as well as collecting powerful relics to defeat various NPCS and explore this world. Captain, raise your sails and venture forward!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Broken Compass - Schermo del Fortune Master
boardgame.description:
User summary:
DM Screen and world map

boardgame.name: The Labyrinth
boardgame.description:
A text-based dungeon crawler with a heavy emphasis on combat and looting. Features 16 playable classes and 40 enemy classes, each with an assortment of 9 unique abilities. Countless combinations of items, enemies, loot, and floors.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Vermitron
boardgame.description:
They're Coming! Get ready to defend your lovely Flower from invading insect! Prepare your Bug Spray, Call your Holo-Pet, Fortify base and don't forget your mission: Find the Watering-Can!

Vermitron is an Retro styled Arcade Twin-Stick shooter with Tower Defense elements inspired by the classic titles like Robotron, Smash-Tv, Gauntlet or PSSST from ZX-Spectrum.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Devour
boardgame.description:
DEVOUR is a co-op horror survival game for 1-4 players. Stop a possessed cult leader before she drags you to hell with her.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: HROT
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





HROT is a single-player retro FPS set in a small socialist country neighboring Soviet Union (Czechoslovakia) after an unspecified disaster in 1986. Those times were dark and terrifying and so is the game.Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Annalynn
boardgame.description:
Annalynn is a 2D platformer made in the style of arcade games from the early '80s. Collect the coins, grab the bonus foods, and turn the tables with blinding rubies! Think you've got what it takes to go for the high score?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Everybody Wham Wham
boardgame.description:
Compete to build the best snowman in a story-driven, winter adventure! Make friends at the festival, tune in to the Wham Wham Radio Station and uncover the hidden truth behind Wham Wham the Snowman-man. Can you build, decorate and sabotage your way to the festival grand prize?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Dragon Creek
boardgame.description:
Ever wanted your own dragon? Dragon Creek is a dragon raising simulator where every dragon is procedurally generated. Enter a seed at the shrine and see your dragon come to life. Care for your dragon as you train it for battle and compete in tournaments!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Kaze and the Wild Masks
boardgame.description:
Journey through the Crystal Islands in 90’s classics platformer style. Play as Kaze and save your friend Hogo from a curse that spread chaos around the islands. Face enraged living vegetables by invoking the powers of the wild masks. Pounce ferociously like a tiger, soar through the sky like an eagle, sprint fiercely like a lizard and rule the sea like a shark.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Air Master
boardgame.description:
Win in one turn at any time. You’re never out of it. Features a novel scoring system.

Air Master is a unique Push Your Luck game, where you fly your way to victory by navigating favourable winds.

But catch the bad ones, and make no progress, or even be blown backwards!

Note the ones that work and find the easy routes to lift the SAVVY crown.

Occasionally during the game, strong headwinds occur, and any gains are lost.

In the final rounds, tropical storms can wreak havoc, and force you further back from where you started.

You have options though, of sitting out potential storms by backtracking, and waiting for it to pass. Or to backtrack at certain stages, and check out alternative flight paths.

You can see the wind strengths you face at each moment of your turn, represented by numbered playing cards.

Taken into consideration with the accompanying wind chart, which shows which cards have already been played, you can see before you call, the success of any choice you make.

The combination of chart and numbered cards make it a very exceptional, and accurate weather forecasting mechanic. Outcomes are based on known probability before you make a call and not random luck.

After each successful forecast, you can call again, and your plane can keep moving forward. However, you must judge when it’s time to bring that part of the journey to an end, as a subsequent wrong weather call will blow you off-course, and lose the progress you have just made.

Misjudging the weather for first calls on turns in the closing stages, equivalent to heavy storms will force your plane back, up to five rows from original starting positions.

There are also random squall areas where you must backtrack a row if wanting to shelter.

Being in the lead is not a given for success. Your progress is never certain, planes can go forwards, and backwards too. Any player can go on a run at anytime and win the game in one turn.

Due to the high average call success rate, (over 75%), it’s very easy to rack up quick points, but you have to put your main focus on when to stop and bank those gains.

Air Master is a non-confrontational game, apart from tactically leaving difficult weather cards for the next player to deal with. However, you are still competing against each other to hit the winning line first. Risks have to be taken, but when?

This is a simple game with odds judgement that will tax even the brightest minds, and levels of addiction that compel you to get involved with other player decisions.

You may find yourself encouraging players to go for it, when really you want them to blow out and drop points. Oh there’s humour alright.

But when the same players then go on long winning runs, you actually want them to succeed. There’s a natural impulse to take interest in other players turns.

Then there’s your playing style. Are you an odds calculator who plays the percentages?

(If you’re into maths and probability, this is right up your street, and you will find good methods of play).

Or are you an instinct player who gets the feel of the cards and plays accordingly?

(Sometimes you’ll see a lopsided number chart, and know a change is coming).

Or never mind all that, you feel lucky and call whatever comes into your head; it's your day right?

( Only when all the luck is with you!)

Or should you play a mix of all three?

Air Master is a game where you sometimes have to step outside your comfort zone, no matter what your base impulses are.
Have you got the nerve to go against your natural instincts if it may win you the game?

So back to the game, do you play, or pass and give the next player something to think about? No thanks there!

Get it wrong and there are penalties. Get it right and you’re on a roll.

Correct calls win points. Fifteen will win it. You can be nearly there, and then start dropping back.

Can you handle the sympathy?

Then there is the fantastic help from your fellow players.

If you want to follow it, dream on – you’re in the wrong game.

Banter has no boundaries here, and some of the advice on offer would make your progress very backward indeed.

Sometimes you will remember a game for the laughs you had, the winner is irrelevant, well nearly. That’s how game sessions go.

Lots of humour and constant dilemmas. ‘’Air Master’’is a one-off rollercoaster.

For 1-6 players, aged 8 and upwards, and a playing time of 30-60 minutes.

The solo mode is limited by the number of plays through the deck. Ten minute playing time.

All age groups can understand the easy game mechanics, and many game plans can be devised, from simple hunch and feel, to varying degrees of mathematical strategies.

Experienced pilots judge the moments well, win more and earn the SAVVY crown.

Components: Game board, number chart, Duo board, 36 playing cards, 6 planes, 6 position markers, 1 squall disc, 1 crown, 35 markers.
1-6 players, 8+, 30-60 mins.

Rules:

Setup: Look through the cards and note the first number from 10 to 14. Place the blue squall disc on this same number on the game board.

Place a plane and position marker on the zero row for each player.

Place the SAVVY crown on the Win row.

Shuffle the cards and put one card aside face down. Lay the deck face down and turn over the top card and place beside it. Cover this number on the chart using the green marker.

(When the deck is depleted during the game, shuffle all the cards, including the card put aside, except the last turned up card, which becomes the new starting point).

How to Play: Choose a player to make first call as to whether the next card is higher or lower. There is a smoother game flow experience if one player manages the cards.

Choose a player to manage the number chart.

After each successful call, move the marker one row forward. If you then make an incorrect call, the marker is returned to the plane, and no progress has been made.

After successful consecutive calls, you may choose to stop, and move the plane forward to join the marker.

After unsuccessful calls, the turn is ended, and play moves clockwise.

Rows 0-3:

You may call again after an incorrect first call, one Free Go per turn.

You may pass your turn on rows 1-3 without penalty.

Rows 4-9:

At the start of your turn, before calling, you may choose to change the top card. However, move your plane and marker back a row.

You mass your turn without penalty.

(If you change the top card and then pass, you will have moved back one row).


Rows 10-14:

If you make an incorrect first call, move your plane and marker back to row 9.

You may choose to change the top card but move your plane and marker back a row.

You may pass on your turn but move your plane and marker back a row.

(If you change the top card and then pass, you will have moved back two rows).

If you change the top card and then make an incorrect first call, you move back to row 9.

Blue disc: This represent a squall. If you elect to stop when on one of these rows, you move back a row.

If you want to pass or change the top card, and that action puts your plane back to a blue row, you move back another row.

The first player to reach the Win area claims the SAVVY crown.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion
boardgame.description:
Play as an adorable yet trouble-making turnip. Avoid paying taxes, solve plantastic puzzles, harvest crops and take on massive beasts all in a journey to tear down a corrupt vegetable government!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Into the Cauldron
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The land has been stricken by a long and lonesome age.

The normal rhythms of life seem to yield no progress.

The days bring no joy.

Fortunately, you are a secret cabal of wizards, and you will bring this sorrow to an end.

Your magic is not fast or flashy, nor is it without effort, but by conducting the right ritual at the right time you may banish a portion of this overshadowing sadness to the void from which it came.

Into The Cauldron is a loosely wizard-flavored LARP played by cooking a communal meal with friends.

boardgame.name: Bushiden
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE

Your sister has vanished and rumors swirl that Gaoh has been resurrected with an evil army at his command. Explore for cybernetic upgrades until you are powerful enough to defeat the diabolic Gaoh and his cybergentic army once and for all in this futuristic, action platformer!

Source: The Publisher Website.

Jack Move is a JRPG that features a unique blend of gritty cyberpunk story telling, turn based battles and beautiful modern pixel art. Take on the role of Noa, a vigilante hacker who is thrust into a world of murder, kidnapping and dark research after her father goes missing.Source: The Publisher Website.

Awakened from dreams of sunlight, a wanderer descends into the ruins.Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Cleo - a pirate's tale
boardgame.description:
Cleo is a solo-developed, top-down, pixel-art, retro, pirate adventure with a lot of nostalgic flair, humor and a linear story, inspired by the old Zelda games and the classic LucasArts adventure games.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Chinatown Detective Agency
boardgame.description:
Chinatown Detective Agency is a cybernoir point and click adventure blending stunning retro design with innovative mechanics. Manage your detective agency and use real world research to solve cases as you unravel a global conspiracy.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Flynn: Son of Crimson
boardgame.description:
Looming darkness begins to awaken

Take on the role of Flynn, a young man orphaned as a child who sets out to chase the shadows of his beginnings whilst awakening the ancient power of Crimson within him.

Discover relics of ancient Rosantica, effigies and monuments to the goddess Sorrell that reveal hints at Flynn’s beginnings and unlock new powers. Reveal secret pathways, trade with villagers, battle fierce monsters, hang out with dogs.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Podezřelí: McGuffinova Aféra
Suspects: Le cas MacGuffin

boardgame.name: Mighty Goose
boardgame.description:
Mighty Goose is a fast paced run & gun shooter starring a bounty hunter Goose. Use epic weapons and devastating war machines to battle against screen filling bosses and hordes of enemies!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Narita Boy
boardgame.description:
Become symphonic in Narita Boy! A radical action-adventure as a legendary pixel hero trapped as a mere echo within the Digital Kingdom. Discover the mysteries behind the Techno-sword, lock swords with the corrupt and tainted Stallions. Save the world!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Brazierisle Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Brazierisle Bestiary (created for the FÖLK-LORE game jam) presents a new territory and six creatures inspired by the Brazilian folklore: the unstoppable predator Mapinguari, the child-devourer Quibungo, the cursed warlord Labatut, the were-anteater Capelobo, the fire serpent Boitatá and the gigantic Cobra Grande.

boardgame.name: Hail! and Well Met!
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

In this exciting new fantasy Solo Dice Adventure game, you generate a band of heroes searching for ancient and legendary items in a fantasy world...of your own design! Includes world building tools that are universal in nature and can easily be used for OSR, HOMEBREW or even THE WORLDS MOST POPULAR FANTASY ROLEPLAYING GAMES.

boardgame.name: An Cailleach
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The Cailleach is the Ancient Earth herself. She is the lichen-covered rocks and the mountain peaks. She is the bared earth covered with snow and frost. She is the Deep Ancestress, veiled by the passage of time. And you were born under her influences.

An Cailleach is an Irish class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Mythic Battles: Ragnarök
boardgame.description:
In Mythic Battles: Ragnarök, take control of Norse divinities and command their forces in the ultimate conflict! While gods and mortals wage war on mighty giants and living dead, strange runes of fire materialize in the Nine Worlds. For centuries, these remnants of primal forces remained out of reach, but now those who dare to wield this awesome power may tip the balance of these world-breaking battles in their favor. The realms are crumbling, the end draws near, and only the mighty shall be remembered.

The Bifrost Bridge has collapsed, trapping Odin and his armies in Asgard. The resulting war in Midgard will be a devastating clash with no assumed victor. Will Ases and Vanes save the Nine Worlds from destruction, or will chaos shatter these realms and reduce Yggdrasil to ashes?

Mythic Battles is a 2 to 4 player legendary adventure, playable as a pure skirmish game, or as an epic saga comprised of numerous scenarios and campaigns. Glorious miniatures and stunning game boards set the scene, decks and dice decide the combat, and the draft mechanic ensures you field a mighty force, destined for glory and victory!

boardgame.name: Cavaletti: Le jeu des clubs houses
boardgame.description:
Cavaletti is designed to review all levels thanks to its 1,100 questions and answers.


It simulates a CSO course (show jumping course).
The hexagonal boxes allow players to follow realistic curves.
All types of obstacles (oxer, wall, spa, vertical, bidet) are available.
The first direction of the obstacle is specified (16 obstacles available).
Rejections, bars and take options can happen.
It is possible to play only with the cards and the booklet as a trivia game.


Goal:

choose a course (among 6 on the board) corresponding to the length of the game you want and
be the first rider to cross the finish line.


Gameplay:
Players move in strides (with the dice) and answer questions (depending on their level, G1-G7) to re-roll or not.
Be careful, if the horse stops on the take-off square or on the obstacle, he has made a refusal or a bar. The rider can get by by answering two questions instead of just one.
